translation.en: RSPCA New South Wales chief inspector David O'Shannessy told the ABC that surveillance and inspections of abattoirs should be commonplace in Australia.
translation.sw: RSPCA New South Wales panin chief inspector David O'Shannessy de too ABC anim sɛ hwɛ a wɔde wɔn ani bɛdi deɛ ɛrekɔ so baabi a wɔkunkum mmoa no ɛsɛ sɛ ɛyɛ biribi a ɛbɛwɔ Australia afanan baabiara.

translation.en: "The CCTV would certainly send a strong signal to those people working with animals that their welfare is of the highest priority."
translation.sw: CCTV no bɛma wɔn a wɔde mmoa di dwuma ahunu sɛ wɔn yiyedi ho hia paa.

translation.en: The United States Geological Survey international earthquake map showed no earthquakes in Iceland in the week prior.
translation.sw: Asase mu nhwehwɛmufo a wↄwↄ United States no wiase nyinaa asasewosow akyerɛkyerɛkwan no daa no adi sɛ, wↄ nnawↄtwe a etwaa mu no,asasewosow biara ansi wↄ Iceland.

translation.en: The Icelandic Meteorological Office also reported no earthquake activity in the Hekla area in the past 48 hours.
translation.sw: Ↄfese a ɛhwɛ Iceland kurow no wim nsakrae so no abↄ amanneɛ sɛ asasewosow biara ensii wↄ Hekla mpↄtam hↄ nnↄnhere 48 a atwam yi.

translation.en: The significant earthquake activity resulting in the phase change had took place on March 10 on the northeast side of the volcano's summit caldera.
translation.sw: Asasewosow a ɛyɛ hu na ɛde nsakrae soronko bae no sii March 10 wↄ tokuro kɛseɛ a ɛda bepↄw no atifi,ne fa a ɛkyerɛ atifi-apueeɛ no.

translation.en: Dark clouds unrelated to any volcanic activity were reported at the base of the mountain.
translation.sw: Amaneɛbↄ kyerɛ sɛ bepↄw no ase yɛɛ kusuu a na ɛnyɛ sɛ ogya bi fi bepↄw no mu ba.

translation.en: The clouds presented the potential for confusion as to whether an actual eruption had taken place.
translation.sw: Mununkum no yɛbea yɛɛ te sɛ nea ogya bi epue fi bepↄw no mu.

translation.en: The Luno had 120–160 cubic metres of fuel aboard when it broke down and high winds and waves pushed it into the breakwater.
translation.sw: Bere a Luno no sɛɛe na mframa twee no kɔɔ breakwater mu no na ɛwɔ fango kubik mita 120–160 .

translation.en: Helicopters rescued the twelve crewmembers and the only injury was a broken nose.
translation.sw: Helicipters kɔ twitwa gyee crewmembers du abien na pira a ɛwom yɛ ɛhwene na ɛho atɔ kyema.

translation.en: The 100-metre ship was en route to pick up its usual fertiliser cargo and initially officials feared the vessel could spill a load.
translation.sw: Na hyɛn a ɛyɛ mita 100 no nam ne kwan a daa ɔfa so sɛ ɛrekɔ fa fertiliser cargo na mfiase no na mpaninfo suro sɛ hyɛn no load no bɛspill.

translation.en: The proposed amendment already passed both houses in 2011.
translation.sw: Nsesae a wɔasusu no wɔagye ne mmienu atom wɔ fie hɔ ɛwɔ 2011 mu.

translation.en: A change was made this legislative session when the second sentence was deleted first by the House of Representatives and then was passed in a similar form by the Senate Monday.
translation.sw: Wɔyɛɛ nsesae wɔ saa mmara yi mu bere a House of Representatives no popaa kasamu a ɛtɔ so abien no na Senate no gye fɔɔm a ɛte saa toom wɔ Dwoada no.

translation.en: The failure of the second sentence, which proposes to ban same-sex civil unions, could possibly open the door for civil unions in the future.
translation.sw: Kasamu a ɛtɔ so abien a annyina, a ɛkasa tia bra wɔbra bɔbeasu-korɔ nna civil unio, ho nsɛm bɛsɔre daakye bi.

translation.en: Following the process, HJR-3 will be reviewed again by the next elected legislature in either 2015 or 2016 to remain in process.
translation.sw: Mmarahyɛfoa wɔato aba ayi wɔn no bɛsane ahwehwɛ HJR-3 no mu wɔ ebia 2015 anaasɛ 2016 na ama wɔatena prosɛse no mu.

translation.en: Vautier's achievements outside of directing include a hunger strike in 1973 against what he viewed as political censorship.
translation.sw: Nneɛma a Vautie atumi ayɛ a akwankyerɛ ma ɛda nkyɛn a, deɛ ɛko ne aduane a ɔde kamee ne ho sɛ ɔnni wɔ afe 1973 a na ɔhunu sɛ ɛyɛ amannyɔsɛm mu nsɛm a wɔde sie ɔmanfo

translation.en: French law was changed. His activism went back to age 15 when he joined the French Resistance during World War II.
translation.sw: Wɔsesaa French mmara no mu. Ne activism no firii ase mfe 15 bere a ɔkɔdɔmm French Resistance no wɔ Wiase ko II

translation.en: He documented himself in a 1998 book.
translation.sw: Ɔkaa n’anaksa ho asɛm wɔ 1998 nwoma mu.

translation.en: In the 1960s he headed back to newly-independent Algeria to teach film directing.
translation.sw: Afe 1960’s mu no ɔde n’ani kyerɛɛ Algeria a na anya faahodie foforɔ no kɔ kyerɛ sɛnea wɔyɛ sini.

translation.en: Japanese judoka Hitoshi Saito, winner of two Olympic gold medals, has died at the age of 54.
translation.sw: Japani a ɔbɔ judoka, Hitoshi Saito dii nkunim wɔ Olympic no mu nyaa sikakɔɔ mɛdaas abien awu na ɔdii mfe 54.

translation.en: The cause of death was announced as intrahepatic bile duct cancer.
translation.sw: Wɔkyerɛ mu sɛ yare a ekumm no ne intrahepatic bile duct kokoram yare no.

translation.en: He died in Osaka on Tuesday.
translation.sw: Owui Benada no wɔ Osaka.

translation.en: As well as a former Olympic and World champion, Saito was the All Japan Judo Federation training committee chairman at the time of his death.
translation.sw: Sɛ obi na ɔbɔ ne mmɔden wɔ Olympic ne waise nyinaa akansi mu no, na Saito na ɔyɛ obi Japan nyinaa mu no na ɔyɛ titena ɛma ahoboaboa kuo bere a ɔwui no.

translation.en: At least 100 people had attended the party, in order to celebrate the first anniversary of a couple whose wedding was held last year.
translation.sw: Anyɛ biara nnipa bɛyɛ 100 na wɔkɔɔ aponto no sɛnea wɔne awarefo no a wɔwaree aferaasɛ no bɛdi wɔn afe edi kan no ho afahyɛ no abom.

translation.en: A formal anniversary event was scheduled for a later date, officials said.
translation.sw: Mpaninfo no kaa sɛ wɔde nkaedi no a wɔbɛdi no ahyɛ bere foforo.

translation.en: The couple had married in Texas one year ago and came to Buffalo to celebrate with friends and relatives.
translation.sw: Na awarefo yi aware wɔ Texas afe a etwaam no na wɔne wɔn nnamfo ne wɔn abusuafo aba Buffalo sɛ wɔrebɛgye wɔn ani.

translation.en: The 30-year-old husband, who was born in Buffalo, was one of the four killed in the shooting, but his wife was not hurt.
translation.sw: Ne kunu a wadi mfe 30 no, wɔwoo no wɔ Buffalo, na ɔka nnipa nnan a wɔkumm wɔn wɔ etu toto no mu, nanso ne yere no ho anka.

translation.en: Karno is a well-known but controversial English tutor who taught under Modern Education and King's Glory who claimed to have 9,000 students at the peak of his career.
translation.sw: Karno yɛ obi a wɔagye na obiara nim no nanso n’asɛm yɛ den a ɔkyerɛ Borɔfo na wakyerɛ ade wɔ Modern Education ne King's Glory ase na ɔka sɛ bere a na n’adwuma no gyina mu no na ɔwɔ asuafo 9,000.

translation.en: In his notes he used words which some parents considered coarse, and he reportedly used profanity in class.
translation.sw: Ne twerɛto hɔ no mu ɔde nsɛmfua bi a awofo bu no sɛ ɛyɛ ahomaso kasa na ɔka sɛ ɔde kasafi di dwuma wɔ adesuadan mu ‘klass’.

translation.en: Modern Education accused him of printing large advertisements on buses without authorisation and lying by saying that he was the chief English tutor.
translation.sw: Modern Education abɔ ne sobo sɛ wɔde ade a wɔde rebɔ wo dawuro a waprente no akɛseakɛse afemfam bɔs no mu a wammisa ɛho kwan ansa na ɔreyɛ saa na ɔdii atoro sɛ ɔne Borɔfo kyerɛkyerɛni panin.

translation.en: He has also been accused previously of copyright infringement, but was not charged.
translation.sw: wɔabɔ no sobo bere bi a atwan sɛ wato copyright ho mmara pɛn nanso wɔamfa no annyina atemu ano.

translation.en: A former student said that he 'used slang in class, taught dating skills in notes, and was just like the students' friend.'
translation.sw: Obi na ɔyɛ sukuuni kaa sɛ ‘ɔde slang na edi dwuma wɔ klass, na ɔkyerɛ kwan ɔkwan obi bɛfa so atwe mpena wɔ ho ade wɔ notes mu na ɔyɛ sukuufo ‘yɔnko’.

translation.en: During the last three decades, despite officially remaining a communist state, China has developed a market economy.
translation.sw: Mfe aduasa atwam no, ɛmfa ho sɛ China akɔ so ayɛ communist man no, ne guadi akɔ ani.

translation.en: The first economic reforms were made under the leadership of Deng Xiaoping.
translation.sw: Deng Xiaoping nniso ase na wɔyɛɛ sikasɛm mu nsakrae a edi kan.

translation.en: Since then, China's economic size has grown by 90 times.
translation.sw: Ɛfiri saa bere no, China sikasɛ atu mpɔn mmɔho 90.

translation.en: For the first time, last year China exported more cars than Germany and surpassed the United States as the biggest market for this industry.
translation.sw: Aferaasɛɛ ne bere a edi kan de kaa kɔ amannɔne kyɛnn Germany na ɛpaa United States a ɔno na ɛyɛ saa ade yi kɛse paa no.

translation.en: China's GDP could be larger than the United States within two decades.
translation.sw: China's GDP bɛtumi ayɛ kɛse asene United states wɔ mfe adunu ntam.

translation.en: Tropical Storm Danielle, fourth named storm of the 2010 Atlantic hurricane season, has formed in the eastern Atlantic Ocean.
translation.sw: Mframa gyampaturudu a yɛfrɛ no Danelle na wɔbɔɔ din sɛ ɛtɔ so nnan wɔ afe 2010 Atlantic hurricane bere no, na abɛyɛ eastern Atlantic Ocean.

translation.en: The storm, located approximately 3,000 miles from Miami, Florida, has maximum sustained winds of 40 mph (64 kph).
translation.sw: Mfram no a ɛyɛ bɛyɛ maale no 3,000 firi Miami,Florida wɔ mframa a ɛyɛ 40 mph (64 kph).

translation.en: Scientists at the National Hurricane Center predict that Danielle will strengthen to a hurricane by Wednesday.
translation.sw: Nyansahunufo a ɔwɔ Ɔman no Hurricane Asoe aka sɛ ennuru Wukada no na Danielle abɛyɛ hurricane .

translation.en: As the storm is far from landfall, it remains difficult to assess potential impact to the United States or Caribbean.
translation.sw: Ɛsiane sɛ mfram no mmɛn landfall nti, ɛbɛyɛ den sɛ yɛbɛhunu nsunsuanso a ɛbɛnya wɔ United States anaasɛ Caribbean so.

translation.en: Born in the Croatian capital, Zagreb, Bobek gained fame while playing for Partizan Belgrade.
translation.sw: Wɔwoo Bobek wɔ Crotia ahenkuro Zagreb mu na ɔgyee din bere na ɔsi akan ma Partizan Belgrade no.

translation.en: He joined them in 1945 and stayed until 1958.
translation.sw: Ɔkɔ dɔmm wɔn 1945 na ɔtenaa kɔ sii 1958

translation.en: During his time with the team, he scored 403 goals in 468 appearances.
translation.sw: Bere na ɔka ku no ho no, ɔtoo atena 403 wɔ akan 468 a ɔsiiɛ no.

translation.en: No one else has ever made more appearances or scored more goals for the club than Bobek.
translation.sw: Obiara nni hɔ a wagyina mu anaasasɛ wato ntena ama ku no asene Bobek.

translation.en: In 1995 he was voted the best player in Partizan's history.
translation.sw: 1995 mu no wɔtoo aba maa no sɛ Partizan abakɔsɛm mu nyinaa no ɔno ne obi a ɔbɔ ne ho mmɔden paaa.

translation.en: The celebrations started with a special show by the world-renowned group Cirque du Soleil.
translation.sw: Anigye no hyɛɛ ase firii Cirque du Soleil kuo a agye din wɔ wiase afanan nyinaa so.

translation.en: It was followed by the Istanbul State Symphony Orchestra, a Janissary band, and the singers Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses.
translation.sw: Deɛ edi so baa ɛno akyi ne Istanbul State Symphony sankɔbɔ a ɛyɛ Janissary band na anwontofo no ne Fatih Erkoç and Müslüm Gürses.

translation.en: Then Whirling Dervishes took to the stage.
translation.sw: Afei Whirling Dervishes baa prama no so.

translation.en: Turkish diva Sezen Aksu performed with the Italian tenor Alessandro Safina and Greek singer Haris Alexiou.
translation.sw: Turkeyni diva Sezen Aksu ne Itanin tenor Alessandro Safina ne Greek singer Haris Alexiou goro boom.

translation.en: To finish, Turkish dance group Fire of Anatolia performed the show "Troy".
translation.sw: Awiee no,Turkey asa ku Fire of Anatolia bɛdii agoru a ɛno ne “Troy”.

translation.en: Peter Lenz, a 13-year-old motorcycle racer, has died after being involved in a crash at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway.
translation.sw: Peter Lenz, a wadi mfe 13 a ɔde motosakre si kan awu na esii bere ɔnyaa akwanhyia wɔ Indianapolis Motor Speedway no so no.

translation.en: While on his warm-up lap, Lenz fell off his bike, and was then struck by fellow racer Xavier Zayat.
translation.sw: Bere na ɔreyɛ warm-up lap no, Lenz firii ne bike no so hwee fam na Xavier Zayat ɔno nso yɛ ɔkansifo no nso bɛtwi faa ne so.

translation.en: He was immediately attended to by the on-track medical staff and transported to a local hospital where he later died.
translation.sw: Ntɛmpa no ara na nnuruyɛfo a wɔwɔ hɔ hwɛɛ no na wɔde no kɔɔ ayaresabea a ɛwɔ mpatam hɔ na akyi na ɔwuiɛ.

translation.en: Zayat was unhurt in the accident.
translation.sw: Zayat ho anksa wɔ akwanhyia yi mu.

translation.en: Regarding the global financial situation, Zapatero continued by saying that "the financial system is a part of the economy, a crucial part.
translation.sw: Ɛdefa wiase nyinaa sikasɛm ho, Zapatero toaa so kaa sɛ “ sikasɛm ka ɛkɔnomi no ho, ɛyɛ biribi a ɛho hia paa.

translation.en: We have a year-long financial crisis, which has had its most acute moment in the past two months, and I think now the financial markets are beginning to recover."
translation.sw: Yɛahyia sikasɛm mu ahokyere afe mu no nyinaa, na emu ayɛ den wɔ abosome abien a atwam ni no, na seesei yɛsusu sɛ sikasɛm no reyɛ yiye ba.”

translation.en: Last week, Naked News announced that it would dramatically increase its international language mandate to news reporting, with three new broadcasts.
translation.sw: Nnawɔtwe a etwaam no, Naked News de too gua sɛ wɔbɛma kasa a wɔka wɔ wiase afanan nyinaa no akɔ n’anim na ma kasebɔ a wɔde to gua no akɔ anim wɔ broadcaste abiɛsa so.

translation.en: Already reporting in English and Japanese, the global organization is launching Spanish, Italian, and Korean-language programs, for television, the web, and mobile devices.
translation.sw: Wɔadi ma kasasebɔ no wɔ Borɔfo ne Japan mu, wiase nyinaa adwumaku yi reda dwumadie ahorow adi wɔ Spanish, Italian ne Korea kasa mu wɔ tɛlevishyin, wɛb ne mobaa afiri so.

translation.en: "Luckily nothing happened to me, but I saw a macabre scene, as people tried to break windows in order to get out.
translation.sw: Me ti yɛɛ yiye biribiara anya ɛme, nanso ahodwiride ‘macabre scene’ , bere na nkorɔfo repre sɛ wɔbɛsɛe mpoma na wɔafiri adi.

translation.en: People were hitting the panes with chairs, but the windows were unbreakable.
translation.sw: Na nkorɔofo de akonnwa nkyɛnmu no,nanso na mpoma no ntumi mmu.

translation.en: One of the panes finally broke, and they started to get out by the window," said survivor Franciszek Kowal.
translation.sw: Franciszek Kowal a ɔnyaa ne ti dii mu kaa sɛ, “ Nkyɛmu no mu biako na awiee no koraa etumi bui, na wɔfii ase faa mpoma mu puepueei”.

translation.en: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements.
translation.sw: Nsroma ɛma nkanea na esiane ɔhyew a ɛfiri hydrogen atom mu bere (aka abom) ayeyɛ nneɛma a emu yɛ duru.

translation.en: Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way.
translation.sw: Nyansahunufo reyɛ reactor a ɛbɛtumi amema energy saa kwan korɔ no arar so.

translation.en: This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.
translation.sw: nanso wei yɛ biribi ayɛ den sɛ ɛbɛtumi asi ani na ɛbɛdi mfe pii na yɛhunu useful fusin reactors noa ayeyɛ.

translation.en: The steel needle floats on top of the water because of surface tension.
translation.sw: Pan a ɛyɛ steel no tɛ nsuo ani esiane surface tension nti.

translation.en: Surface tension happens because the water molecules at the surface of the water are strongly attracted to each other more than they are to the air molecules above them.
translation.sw: Surface tension esiane sɛ nsuo no molecues a ɛwɔ nsuo no ase no ne wɔn ho hyia paa sene sɛnea ɛne mframa molecules a ɛwɔ soro sene wɔn no.

translation.en: The water molecules make an invisible skin on the water’s surface that allows things like the needle to float on top of the water.
translation.sw: Nsuo no molecules no yɛ nvisible skin wɔ nsu no ano na ɛma nneɛma te sɛ paneɛ tɛ nsu no ani.

translation.en: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted.
translation.sw: Blade a ɛwɔ nnɛ mmerɛ yi mu ice skate so no wɔ ano abien na ɛwɔ concave hollow ne ntam. Ano abien yi ma kwan ma grasp of ice no tumi kɔ mu, sɛ mpo etumi keka no ho ‘ayɛ tilted’ a.

translation.en: Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves.
translation.sw: Esiane sɛ blade no ase no akyea kakra no nti, bere a blade no kɔ ɔfa baako anaa foforɔ no, baabi a ɛne ice no adi ahyia no nso kyea.

translation.en: This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.
translation.sw: Wei ma skater no dane ne ho. Sɛ skates no kyea kɔ nifa a, skater no dane kɔ nifa, na sɛ skates no kyea kɔ benkum a, skater no dane kɔ benkum.

translation.en: To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light.
translation.sw: Sɛ ɛbsane akɔ energyɛ lɛɛvo dada no a, ɛsɛ eyi energy a ɛka ho a wɔnya firii kanea no mu no.

translation.en: They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a "photon".
translation.sw: Wɔyɛ wei bere a eyi nneɛma nketewa bi a yɛfrɛ no “photon” no.

translation.en: Scientists call this process "stimulated emission of radiation" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation.
translation.sw: Nyansahunufo frɛ saa kwan yi "stimulated emission of radiation" ɛfiri sɛ atoms no kanea a ahyerɛn no na ɛstimulati no, na ɛkɔ photon of light emission no ba, na kane ano yɛ radion ku no bi.

translation.en: The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture.
translation.sw: Mfoni a edi so no kyerɛ atoms aemitting photons. Ɛyɛ nokware sɛ photons susua sene deɛ ɛwowɔ mfoni yi mu no.

translation.en: Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!
translation.sw: Photons no sua sene nneɛma ɛbɛyɛ atoms no!

translation.en: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works.
translation.sw: Filamenta a ɛwɔ bulb no mu hyeeɛ na kanea bulb no antumi anyɛ adwuma bio wɔ nnɔnhwere pii a wɔde yɛɛ adwuma bebree no akyi.

translation.en: The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb.
translation.sw: Kanea bulb no hia nsesa. Ɛsɛ sɛ woyɛ ahweyiye bere a woresesa kanea bulb no.

translation.en: First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected.
translation.sw: Deɛ edi kan, baabi a wɔde dum no sane de sɔ no, ɛsɛ sɛ ɛda baabi adum anaasɛ ɛsɛ sɛ wɔtwa nhama no mu.

translation.en: This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.
translation.sw: Deɛ nti a ɛte saa ne sɛ anyinam ahoɔden wɔ sɔkɛt no mu baabi ɛyɛ dade no a bulb no wɔ no na ɛbɛtumi ahyɔɔko wo sɛ wo nsa kɔ wura sɔkɛte no mu anaasɛ dade no ase wɔ bulb no mu bere a kakra ɛhyɛ sɔkɛte no mu no.

translation.en: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood.
translation.sw: Akwaa titire a ɛwɔ circuatory sistɛm mu ne akoma no, a ɛno ɛpɔpe mmogya no.

translation.en: Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.
translation.sw: Mogya nofiri akoma no mu pue wɔ nnubɛn bi a yɛfrɛ no arteries na ɛsane nam nnurubɛn bi a yɛfrɛ no veins mu sane ba akoma no mu. Nnurubɛn a esusua paa no de capillaries.

translation.en: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots.
translation.sw: Triceratops se bɛtumi abɔ ade mu na ɛnyɛ nhaban nko mpo mman a ne nhini a emu yɛ den mpo.

translation.en: Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous.
translation.sw: Abɔdeԑmunyasapԑ binom dwene Triceratops adi cycads, a ɛno ne afifide ɛnyɛ na koraa wɔ Cretaceous.

translation.en: These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves.
translation.sw: Saa afifide yi sɛ abɛdua ketewa a ɛwɔ ahenkyɛw, na ahaban no yɛ nkasɛɛnkasɛɛ.

translation.en: A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk.
translation.sw: Anka Triceratops betumi de n’ano a ɛyɛ den no ate nhaban no ansa na wawe dua no.

translation.en: Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.
translation.sw: Abɔdeԑmunyasapԑ nkae ka sɛ saa afifide yɛ awurudu na ɛntumi mma sɛ dinosaur diiɛ, ɛwom sɛ nnɛ sloth ne mmoa afofor te sɛ ako (a wɔyɛ dinosaurs asefo) tumi we nhaban no anaasɛ aba no.

translation.en: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth.
translation.sw: Lo gravity bɛtwe me kwan bɛn so? Sɛ wogyina lo no so a, wommu duru no ɛnyɛ te sɛ deɛ na ɛte wɔ Asase so.

translation.en: A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.
translation.sw: Nnipa ne mu duru yɛ 200 pounds (90kg) wɔ Asase so no mu duru bɛyɛ 36 pounds (16kg) wɔ lo so. Gravity no ntwee wo pii.

translation.en: The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma.
translation.sw: Awia nni crust te sɛ Asase no so a wobɛtumi agyina so. Awia no yɛ gyaframa, gya ne plasma.

translation.en: The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun.
translation.sw: Gyaframa no bɛyɛ hahaaha bere a wofi Awia no mfimfin kɔ akyikyi.

translation.en: The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means "ball of light".
translation.sw: Deɛ a ɛwɔ abɔntene a yɛhunu sɛ wohwɛ Awia yɛfrɛ no fotosphere, a ԑkyerԑ "Kanea Bɔɔl".

translation.en: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does.
translation.sw: Mfe mpem abiɛsa akyi no, wɔ 1610, Italini a ɔhwɛ nsoroma Galileo Galilei de telescope di dwuma hunu sɛ Venus wɔ afaafa sɛnea ɔsram te no.

translation.en: Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun.
translation.sw: Afaafa no kɔ so wɔ Venus no fa nko ara (anaasɛ wɔ Ɔsram no) a ɛhwɛ Awia no sɔ. Venus no afaafa no foa tiɔri ɛne Copernicus a okyinsrom ano de twa Awia no ho.

translation.en: Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.
translation.sw: Afei, wɔ mfe bi akyi wɔ 1639, nsromamuhwɛni bi a ɔyɛ Englishni a yɛfrɛ no Jeremiah Horrocks hwɛɛ Venus transit no.

translation.en: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw.
translation.sw: Na England atena hɔ asomdwoe mu bere tenten fiti bere a ɔdii Danelaw so nkonim no.

translation.en: However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier.
translation.sw: Nanso wɔ 991 Ethelred hyiaa Viking dɔm a na wɔdɔɔ so kyɛn biara fiti Guthrum mfeha na edi kan no a.

translation.en: This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination.
translation.sw: Olaf Trygvasson na ɔdii dɔm yi anim, na ɔyɛ Norweni a na wawe ahinam so sɛ ɔbɛgye ne man a Danishfoɔ agye abɔ so no afiri wɔn nsam.

translation.en: After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.
translation.sw: Bere a edi kan a asrafo no nneɛma yɛɛ bisi basa no, Ethelred bɛtee Olaf ase, na ɔsan kɔɔ Norway sɛ ɔbɛkɔ akɔ hwɛ sɛ ɔbɛtumi akɔkyekyere n’aheman na nkonimdi pii afi mu aba.

translation.en: Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450).
translation.sw: Hangeul nko ara ne atwerɛde a wɔahyɛda ayɛ a wɔde di dwuma daa. Wɔyɛɛ atwerɛde no1444 wɔ Ɔhene Sejong aheni mu (1418 - 1450).

translation.en: King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded.
translation.sw: Na Ɔhene Sejong ne ɔhen a ɔtɔ so wɔ Joseon Dynasty na ɔyɛ obi na wɔbu no paa.

translation.en: He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means "the correct sounds for the instruction of the people".
translation.sw: Mfiase no ɔtoo Hangeul atwerɛde no din Hunmin Jeongeum a ɛkyerɛ, nnyegyee a ɛyɛ a wɔde ma nnipa akwankyerɛ”.

translation.en: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them.
translation.sw: Tiɔre ahorow bebree wɔ hɔ ɛka sɛnea ɛyɛe a Sanskrit baae. Ɛmu biako ɛfa Aryan tu a wɔtu firii atɔe baa India na wɔreba no na wɔde kasa no baaeɛ.

translation.en: Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe.
translation.sw: Sanskirt yɛ tete kasa na wɔde toto Latin kasa a wɔka no wɔ Europe no ho.

translation.en: The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy.
translation.sw: Nwoma a akyɛ wɔ waise paa a wnim no wɔ twerɛɛ Sanskirt. Bere a wɔboaboaa Upanishads, Sanskrit twaam esiane hierarchy nti.

translation.en: Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.
translation.sw: Sanskirt yɛ den paa na ɛyɛ kasa a ɛyɛ kama, a ɛno ne mprenpren Indian kasa ahorow no fibea, sɛnea latin yɛ Europe kasa fibea te sɛ French ne Spanish.

translation.en: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain.
translation.sw: Berea france ako no baa awiee no, Germany yɛɛ ahoboa sɛ wɔbɛkɔ Britain island no so.

translation.en: Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak.
translation.sw: Germany frɛɛ ntohyɛso no “ “Operation Sealion”. Britain Asraafo no akode akɛse akɛse ne supplies dodow no ara na ayerayera bere a wɔtu fii Dunkirk, enti na asraafo no no ayɛ mmerɛ.

translation.en: But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel.
translation.sw: Nanso na Royal Navy no ho yɛ den sene German navy no (“Kriegsmarine”) na anka wɔbɛtumi asɛe invasion fleet a akɔ Borɔfo Channel no.

translation.en: However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.
translation.sw: Nanso Royal navy hyɛmma no mu kakraa bi pɛ na ɛbɛn invasion routes no esiane sɛ na wɔn a wɔpɛ no suro sɛ Germanfo bɛtu ade afa wim aba wɔn so.

translation.en: Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the "little brother" of Germany and Japan.
translation.sw: Ma yɛmfa adwene a Italy nni kan. Na Italy yɛ Germany ne Japan “nua kumaaa”.

translation.en: It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war.
translation.sw: Na wɔn army ne wɔn navy no nni hoɔden, ɛwom sɛ wɔayɛ hyɛmma afoforo nnan ansa na ako no rebɛfi ase.

translation.en: Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa.
translation.sw: Italy boate titire paa ne Afrika aman. Sɛ wɔbnya saa aman yi, ɛsɛ sɛ wɔnya asraafo naunching paade, asraafo yi bɛfa Mediterranean po na wɔkɔpue Afrika.

translation.en: For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else.
translation.sw: Wɔbɛtumi ayɛ saa gye sɛ wɔyi Britain atenae ne hyɛm no firi Egypt. Saa adeyɛ yi da nkɛyɛn a, Italy hyɛn a wɔde di ako no na ɛnsɛ sɛ ɛyɛ biribi foforo biara.

translation.en: Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain.
translation.sw: Afei Japan. Na Japan yɛ islanf man, te sɛ Britain.

translation.en: Submarines are ships designed to travel underwater, and remain there for an extended amount of time.
translation.sw: Submarines yɛ hyɛm a wɔahyɛ da ayɛ sɛ entu kwan wɔ nsu ase na ɛkɔ so tena bere tenten bi mu.

translation.en: Submarines were used in World War I and World War II. Back then they were very slow and had a very limited shooting range.
translation.sw: Wɔde Submarines dii dwuma Wiase Ko I ne Wiase Ko II no mu. Saa bere na ɛkɔ nyaa na wowom na woto tuo a na ɛntumi nkɔ akyiri.

translation.en: In the beginning of the war they mostly travelled on top of the sea, but as radar began developing and becoming more accurate the submarines were forced to go under water to avoid being seen.
translation.sw: Ako no mfiase no na na ɛtaa tɛ nsu no ani, na bere a bere radar fii ase bae no ɛbɔɔ adwuma pɛpɛɛpɛ na eyi hyɛɛ submarine s no maa ɛkɔɔ nsu no ase tonn na obiara ahunu no.

translation.en: German submarines were called U-Boats. The Germans were very good at navigating and operating their submarines.
translation.sw: Na wɔfrɛ Gemany submarines no U-Boats. Na Germanfo no bɔ wɔn ho mmɔden wɔ sɛ navigeeti ne dwumadi mu.

translation.en: Because of their success with submarines, after the war Germans aren't trusted to have many of them.
translation.sw: Esiane wɔn nkunimdi wɔ submarines ho nti, akodi no akyi wɔnnye Germanfo sɛ wɔnni bebree.

translation.en: Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as "King Tut" or "The Boy King", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times.
translation.sw: Aane! Ɔhene Tutankhamun, ɛtɔ da wɔfrɛ no “ɔhene Tut" anaasɛ "The Boy King", yɛ tete Egypt ahene a wɔnim wɔ nnɛ mmere yi mu.

translation.en: Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists.
translation.sw: Deɛ ɛyɛ dɛ no, na wɔmmu no nɛ ne hia paa tete no na wɔnka tete ahene dodow a wɔayɛ wɔn din ho twerɛtohɔ no.

translation.en: However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed.
translation.sw: Ne nna wɔhuu wɔ 1922 maa wɔbɛyɛɛ obi a wagye din. Bere na wɔabuebue tete nna dodow no ara so awia mu nneɛma no, saa nna yi na obiara nkaa no.

translation.en: Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones.
translation.sw: Nneɛma dodo no a wɔde siee Tutankhamun no wɔakora so yiye, a artefacts mpempem a wɔde nnade ayeyɛ ne abɔ ɛho yɛ na.

translation.en: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots.
translation.sw: Wheels a ɛyɛ dede a ɛbaae no ama Assyrian apɔnkɔ mu ayɛ ha,ɛkɔ ntɛm na wɔasiesie no etumi san asraafo ho ne apɔnkɔ nkae ho.

translation.en: Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry.
translation.sw: Wɔn peaw a efiri wɔn crossbows mu no tumi wura kyɛm a ɛhyɛ asraafo a wɔyɛ atamfo no mu. Bɛyɛ 1000 B.C mu na Assyrianfo kɔfaa cavalry a edi kan baae.

translation.en: A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.
translation.sw: Cavlry yɛ ɔsraani a ɔtena pɔnkɔ so di ako. na wɔnnya nyɛɛ no, enti Assyrianfo cavalry tenaa wɔn apɔnkɔ so kɛkɛ na wɔkooe.

translation.en: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey.
translation.sw: Yɛnim Greek amannyɔfo,nyansahufo ne adwiniyɛfo pii. Deɛ wagye din pa wɔ amammere wei mu ne Homer, a na ɔyɛ anwonsɛmkafo a n’ani afiri no a ɔyɛɛ Greekfo kasadwini abien: anwonsɛm Iliad neOdyssey.

translation.en: Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature.
translation.sw: Sophocles ne Aristophanes yɛ playwrights a ɛda so ara agye din na wɔbu wɔn nnwuma no sɛ wiase nyinaa kasadwini mu no ɛka deɛ ɛyɛ papa paa no ho.

translation.en: Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.
translation.sw: Greekni foforo a wagye yiye ne nkotabufo Pythagoras, a deɛ obiara de nim ne theorem a agye din a ɛfa relations a ɛfa right triangles afa ahorow ho no.

translation.en: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world.
translation.sw: Akonta a wɔbu fa wɔn a wɔka Hinda kasa no ho gu ahorw. Wɔbu akonata ɛno ne kasa a ɛtɔ so abien anaa nnan wɔka wɔ wiase paa.

translation.en: The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted.
translation.sw: Wɔn a ɛyɛ wɔ kurom kasa dodow no gu ahorow na egyina kasa no nkorabata a wɔka no so anaasɛ wɔkan kasa no nkorabata a ɛbenbɛn no.

translation.en: Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language.
translation.sw: Wɔn a wɔka no akonatbu kyerɛ sɛ wɔn dodow bɛyɛ ɔpepem 340 kɔsi ɔpepem 500 na dodow bɛyɛ ɔpepem 800 na wɔte kasa yi.

translation.en: Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.
translation.sw: Nsɛmfua a ɛwɔ Hundi ne Urdu mu no sesɛ nanso wɔn atwerɛ nyɛ pɛ, daadaa nkɔmmɔbɔ mu no nnipa a wɔka kasa yi tumi te wɔn mu biara kasa a wɔreka no ase.

translation.en: Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany.
translation.sw: Bɛyɛ afeha ɛtɔ so 15 no, na Estonia atifihyɛ Germany amammere ase.

translation.en: Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language.
translation.sw: Na German monks pɛsɛ wɔtwe nnipa no bɛn Onyankopɔn,eno nti wɔka faa Estonian literal kasa no baae.

translation.en: It was based on the German alphabet and one character "Õ/õ" was added.
translation.sw: Na egyina German akyerɛwde no so na wɔde akyerɛwde biako "Õ/õ" kaa ho.

translation.en: As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment.
translation.sw: Bere kɔɔ so no, wɔfɛmm nsɛmfua dodo no ara firii German mu bɛka boom. Wei ne nkɔanim no mfiase.

translation.en: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school.
translation.sw: Amammrε kwan so no, nea adedi rebɛduru ne so no sɛ ɔwie sukuu ara pɛ a ɛsɛ sɛ ɔkɔ sraadi.

translation.en: However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree).
translation.sw: Nanso Charles kɔɔ suapɔn wɔ Rinity Kɔlegyi, Cambridge na ɛhɔ na ɔsuaa Anthropology ne Archaeology na akyi abakɔsɛm na wɔnyaa 2:2 ( (a ɛyɛ sekɛnd klass lowa digirii).

translation.en: Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.
translation.sw: Charles ne obi a ɔwɔ Britain Adehye Abusua no a wɔmaa no digirii abodin.

translation.en: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country.
translation.sw: European Turkey ( Thrace apue anaasɛ Rumelia wɔ Balkan peninsula no) ɛka ɔman no ho 3% .

translation.en: The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape.
translation.sw: Turkey no nsaase no tenten boro kilomita 1,600 (1,000 mi) ne trɛ yɛ 800 km(500 mi), na ayɛ ne ho ahinanan hyeepu.

translation.en: Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe.
translation.sw: Turkey mmea a deɛ ɛka ho ne atadeɛ, ɛfa kilomit no square 783,562 (300,948 sq mi), a emu 755,688 kilomita square no (291,773 sq mi) ɛwɔ Asia anaafo atɔe ne kilomita square23,764 (9,174 sq mi) wɔ europe.

translation.en: Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined.
translation.sw: Turkey na wiase nyiaa man a ɛso no ɛtɔ 37 na ɛte sɛnea wɔaka Metropolitan France ne United Kingdom abom.

translation.en: Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
translation.sw: Ɛpo atwitwa Turkey afa abiɛsa ho ahyia: Aegean po no kɔ atɔe, Ɛpo Tuntum no kɔ atifi ɛna Mediterranean Po no kɔ anaafo.

translation.en: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839.
translation.sw: Luxembourg wɔ abakɔsɛm tenten anso wɔn faahodien no firi 1839.

translation.en: Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution.
translation.sw: Na nnɛ mmerɛ yi mu Belgium ɛka Luxembourg bi a atwam na ɛbɛyɛɛ Belgian 1830s Belgian Ɔamni anidani ‘Revolution’ no akyi.

translation.en: Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany.
translation.sw: Luxembourg abɔ mmɔden sɛ ɛbɛyɛ ɔman a ennyina ɔfa biara nanso Wiaso KO I ne Wiase Ko II mu Germanyfo kɔ gyee hɔ kɛntɛnn so.

translation.en: In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.
translation.sw: 1957 mu no, Luxembourg bɛkaa wɔn wɔtee ahyehyɛde a ɛnnɛ yɛfrɛ no European Union no ho.

translation.en: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village).
translation.sw: Drukgyal Dzong yɛ ɛdan a ɛyɛ den a asɛe ne Buddhist monastery a ɛwɔ Paro mansini mu wɔatifi fam (ɛwɔ Phondey akuraase).

translation.en: It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces.
translation.sw: Wɔkyerɛ sɛ 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel sii ɔdan ahoɔden wom yi de kaae nkunim wɔ Tibetan-Mongo akofo so no.

translation.en: In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal.
translation.sw: 1951 mu no, ogya maa Drukgyal Dzong tete ade bi ɛho hia wɔ ɔsom mu ‘relics’ no kae, te sɛ Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal mfoni.

translation.en: After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.
translation.sw: Egya no aky no, ɔdan ɛwɔ ahoɔden a hwee ntumi no wɔkoraa so bɔɔ ho ban, na ɛyɛ Bhutan mmea ɛtwetwe nkorɔfo ba hɔ paa no biako.

translation.en: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam.
translation.sw: Afeha ɛtɔ so 18 mu no, amanifo abien na na wɔpree Cambodia ho, Thailand ne Vietnam.

translation.en: The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen.
translation.sw: Thaifo no kɔɔ Cambodia mprɛ pii wɔ afe ha ɛtɔ so 18 na afe 1772 mu no wɔsɛɛe Phnom Phen.

translation.en: In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
translation.sw: Afeha ɛtɔ so 18 mu no Vietnamfo nso bepuee mu wɔ Cambodia.

translation.en: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy.
translation.sw: Venezuelafo mu ɔha nkyekyɛmu edu nnwɔtwe na wɔnnyɛ adwuma na wɔn a wɔyɛ adwuma no mu dodo no ara yɛ adwuma wɔ nfɔmaa ɛkɔnɔmi mu.

translation.en: Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture.
translation.sw: Venezuelafo a wɔyɛ adwuma no, wɔkyɛ wɔn mu abiɛsa a wɔn mu abien na wɔwɔ ɔsom afa mu, wɔn mu anan mu nkyεmu baako yɛ adwuma wɔ mfridwuma mu na wɔn wɔto nnum yɛ kuadwuma.

translation.en: An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.
translation.sw: Ndastre a ɛwɔ Venezuela paa ne fango, a ɛno na ɔman no de kɔ aguaman so,ɛwom sɛ nnipa wɔyɛ adwuma wɔ hɔ no yɛ ɔha nkyekyɛmu biako pɛ.

translation.en: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City.
translation.sw: Ɔman no faahodiemfiase no, Singapore Botanic Gardens animdefo boa ma wɔsiesiee island no ma ɛbɛyɛɛ trɔpikaa Turo a ɛyɛ fɛ.

translation.en: In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.
translation.sw: 1981 mu no, wɔpaw Vanda Miss Joaquim, a ɔyɛ orchid hybrid, sɛ ɔman nyinaa nhwire ‘mfrawɛse’.

translation.en: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains.
translation.sw: Afe biara bɛyɛ Ahineme mu no, mmoa wɔwe wura bɛyɛ ɔpepem 1.5 na wɔkɔ anafo fam, wɔtwa Mara asubɔnten a wɔfiri mmepɔ no atifi ɛma nsu no.

translation.en: And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April.
translation.sw: Na wɔsan ba atifi a ɛyɛ atifi a wɔnam atɔe,afe wɔsan twa asubɔnten Mara bio bere nsuo no ate wɔ Oforisuo mu.

translation.en: The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.
translation.sw: Serengeti mantam no wɔ Serengeti Ɔman mu Paake, Ngorongoro Bea a Wɔakora so ne Maswa Wurammmoa Atenae a Wɔagya ɛwɔ Tanzania ne Maasai Mara Ɔman mu Beae bi a Wɔagya ato hɔ a ɛwɔ Kenya

translation.en: Learning to create interactive media requires conventional and traditional skills, as well as tools mastered in interactive classes (storyboarding, audio and video editing, story telling, etc.)
translation.sw: Sua woresua sɛ wobɛyɛ midia a ɛyɛ anika no hia kɔnvɛnhyinaa ne tradihyinaa nimde, na wohunu sɛnea wode nnwinade bedi dwumayiye wɔ klaase (storyboarding, audio ne vidio ɛditin, anansesɛm to, ne ade)

translation.en: Interactive design requires that you re-assess your assumptions about media production and learn to think in a non-linear ways.
translation.sw: Interactive design hwehwɛ sɛ wobɛsane ayɛ wo nsusui a ɛfa midia dwumadi ‘production’ na woasua sɛnea wobɛsusu nneɛma ho wɔ akwan ahorow so ho no mu nhwehwɛmu .

translation.en: Interactive design requires that components of a project connect to each other, but also make sense as a separate entity.
translation.sw: Interactive design hwehwɛ sɛ dwumadi no afa ahorow no ne ne nkae no wɔ nsawɔso di, nanso ɛno nko wɔ hɔ ntease wom.

translation.en: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses.
translation.sw: Ade a ɛnyɛ wɔ zoom lɛnse ne sɛ; focal complexity ne lɛns elemɛnts nɔma dodowehia na ama aduru baabi a fooka legths wɔ no kyɛn prima lɛnses.

translation.en: This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production.
translation.sw: Wei nyɛ biribi a ɛha adwenr esiane sɛ wɔn a wɔyɛ lɛns no aduru akyi paa wɔ lɛnse yɛ mu.

translation.en: This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length.
translation.sw: Wei ama Zoom lɛnses kwan ma ɛma mfoni a ɛyɛ fɛ sɛ yɛde toto lɛnses a ɛwɔ fokaa legth no ho a.

translation.en: Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower.
translation.sw: Ade biako aɛnyɛ wɔ zoom lɛnses ho ne sɛnea aperture (mmirika no) ma lɛnse no taa yɛ nyaa no.

translation.en: This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.
translation.sw: Wei ma ɛye den sɛ zoom lɛnses a ne bo nyɛ den a wode bɛdi dwuma wɔ baabi nkanea nni a flash nni no yɛ den.

translation.en: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan.
translation.sw: Ɔhaw biako a ɛtaa ba bere a wode sini regu DVD so ne ovasikan.

translation.en: Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public.
translation.sw: Wɔayɛ tɛlɛvihyin dodoɔ no ara sɛ ɔmanfo no ani nnye ho.

translation.en: For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides.
translation.sw: Esiane yei nti, biribiara wobɛhunu wɔ Tv so no, na wɔatwitwa ano no so, soro, ase ne nkyɛnkyɛnmu.

translation.en: This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan.
translation.sw: Wɔyɛ yei sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ a mfoni no bɛfa so nyinaa. Yei na yɛfrɛ no ovasikan.

translation.en: Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.
translation.sw: Awerɛhosɛm ne sɛ, sɛ woyɛ DVD a, baabi bɛtumi afirim, na sɛ sini no wɔ ntwerɛeɛ a ɛwɔ ase mpo a, wɔnhu ne nyinaa.

translation.en: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry.
translation.sw: Tete abankɛse a ɛwɔ boro adwene ne nteaseɛ so, ɛde mfonin a ɛrekyerɛ sɛ wɔtete apɔnkɔ so kura peaw, bakwɛɛte ne Arthurian chivalry.

translation.en: Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits.
translation.sw: Mpo sɛ wogyina nnoɔma a atwam mfe apem no so a, wotumi kae ako a abɛtwam no ho a, wommerɛ ho koraa, na wɔtumi te apɔnkɔ no nan ase dede sɛ ɛnam aboɔ so ne ehu a efiri amena donkodonko no aka.

translation.en: But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?
translation.sw: Nanso yɛn nsusuiɛ no gyina sɛ nea ɛteɛ so anaa? Deɛ edi kan koraa no, adɛn nti na wɔsisii abankɛse? Kwan bɛn na wɔfaa so yɛɛ ho nhyehyɛe na wɔsiie?

translation.en: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle.
translation.sw: Te sɛ bere no,Kirby Muxloe Castle yɛ efi abɔne ho ban kyɛn castle ankasa.

translation.en: Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long.
translation.sw: Ne mpoma akɛse na afasu mfeamfeaa ntumi nnyina ntohyɛso a anka ɛbɛkyɛ no.

translation.en: In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.
translation.sw: 1480s mu no, bere Lord Hastings fii ne si ase no, na ɔman no mu dwo na wɔhia banbɔ de kotaia nnipa kakra bi wɔnenam fom nkorɔfo nneɛma no.

translation.en: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states.
translation.sw: Na balance of power no yɛ sistɛm a Europe aman nam so hwehwɛ sɛ Europe ama no nyinaa bɛyɛ adehye aman.

translation.en: The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance.
translation.sw: Na adwene no nyinaa ne sɛ ɛmma Europe aman no bi mmɛ nya tumi nkyɛn nkae no, na national governments taa sesa deɛ wɔne bɔ no ‘alliences’ na ama biriribiara ayɛ pɛpɛɛpɛ.

translation.en: The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power.
translation.sw: Spanish Succession ako no na ɛbɛyɛɛ ako a edi kan asɛm a na ɛda gua so tumi a ɛyɛ pɛpɛɛpɛ.

translation.en: This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.
translation.sw: Wei yɛ biribi aɛho hia paa, esiane na Europe tumidi no nkɔ nko nka sɛ wɔreko ɔsom ako. Kyerɛ sɛ, Mfe aduasa Ako no bɛyɛ deɛ etwa sɛ ɛno ne ɔsom ako aetwa to.

translation.en: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus.
translation.sw: Artemis beae a wɔsom a ɛwɔ Ephesus no wɔsɛɛe no Kitawonsa 21, 356 BCE na ɛyɛ ogya na ɛtoo mu na deɛ wɔyɛɛ saa ne Herostratus.

translation.en: According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded.
translation.sw: Asɛm no kyerɛ sɛ, deɛ ɛhyɛɛ ne mpamden ne sɛ ɔbɛgye din kwan biara so.

translation.en: The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born.
translation.sw: Greek abakɔsɛm ho ɔbenfo Strabo twerɛɛ din no, a ɛno na yɛnim no nnɛ no. Wɔsɛɛe beae a wɔsom no saa anadwo no a wɔwoo Alexander Ɔkɛse no.

translation.en: Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.
translation.sw: Alexander, sɛ ɔhene no, yɛɛ sɛ ɔbɛfa asɔrefi a ɔresan asi no ho ka, nanso wɔampene so. Akyi bere Alexander wuui no, wɔsan sii asɔre fi no wɔ 323 BCE.

translation.en: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers.
translation.sw: Hwɛ sɛ wo nsa no ayɛ relaxed bere a worebɔ notes no pɛpɛpɛɛ - afei nso bɔ mmɔden sɛ wontwetwe wo nsa sɛnea ɛnsɛ.

translation.en: This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano.
translation.sw: Saa kwan yi so no, wommerɛ pii koraa. Kae sɛ ɛho nhia sɛ wode ahoɔden bɛmia keys so sɛ wopɛ sɛ volume no kɔ soro wɔ piano so.

translation.en: On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.
translation.sw: Accordion so no, sɛ wopɛ volume no bi aka ho a, fa bellows no di dwuma na pressure anaasɛ supiidi mmara mu.

translation.en: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God.
translation.sw: Mysticism yɛ pursuit of communion, adida anaasɛ conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, ahintasɛm, honhom mu nokwasɛm anaasɛ Nyankopɔn.

translation.en: The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties.
translation.sw: Gyidini no hwehwɛ suahunu tee, nkate anaasɛ nya anisoadehunu wɔ devine reality/ɔbosom no anaasɛ abosom.

translation.en: Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences.
translation.sw: Akyitaafo di asetena kwan bi akyi, anaasɛwɔyɛ nneɛma bi ɛma wɔtete saa suahunu no.

translation.en: Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.
translation.sw: Mysticism bɛtumi ada nso afiri ɔsom mu gyidi nkae ho na ɛsom na ɛde n’ani si ankorɛankorɛ suahunu wɔ state of consciousness mu,titire deɛ ɛyɛ asomdwoe,insightful, blissful anaasɛ mpo ecstatic character.

translation.en: Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition.
translation.sw: Sikhism yɛ ɔsom a ɛfiri Indian anafo fam. Ɛhyɛɛ ase firii Punjab mantam firi afeha a ɛtɔ so 15 na ɛfiri Hindu amammere a emu paapaee no mu na ɛbaae.

translation.en: Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions.
translation.sw: Sikhs hunu sɛ wɔn som no da nso wɔ Hinduism ho ɛwom wɔgye tom sɛ wɔfi Hundu mu de.

translation.en: Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for "way of the guru". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs.
translation.sw: Sikhs frɛ wɔn som no Gurmat, a ɛyɛ Punjabi asɛmfu asɛm “guru no kwan”. Guru no yɛ Indian ɔsom nyinaa fapem nanso Sikhism mu no,nanso Sikhism agye Sikh gyidi a ɛho pa no atom.

translation.en: The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus.
translation.sw: Guru Nanak na ɔtee ɔsom yi wɔ afeha a ɛtɔ so 15 (1469–1539). Gurus nkron dii wei akyi ntoaso ntoaso.

translation.en: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism.
translation.sw: Nanso wɔ ayɛwohumummɔ 1956 mu no,wɔsɔɔ Krushchev bɔhyɛ no hwɛɛe bere na sakasa rekɔ so wɔ Poland, a na adwumayɛfo reyɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ nnuane a na ɛho ayɛ den ne akatua nteso so,na ɛdane bɛyɛɛ ɔyɛkyerɛ a wɔyɛ tiaa Communism.

translation.en: Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
translation.sw: Awiee no, Krushchev de dorobɛn kↄe ma ɛhɔ daa dinn, ɔmaa nneɛma na wɔrepɛ no bi kwan na ɔtee ase paw Wladyslaw Gomulka a na wagye din paa no sɛ ɔmansoafo foforo.

translation.en: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan.
translation.sw: Indus Valley Anibue yɛ Bronze Bere mu anibue wɔ India atifiatɔe ubcontinent a nnɛ mmerɛ yi mu Pakistan ne amantam bi a ɛwɔ India ne Afghanistan atifiatɔe.

translation.en: The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name.
translation.sw: Anibue no kɔɔ anim wɔ Indus asubɔntene basins no mu baabi a enyaa ne din firiiɛ.

translation.en: Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.
translation.sw: Ɛwom sɛ abenfo bi keka sɛ esiane sɛ na anibue bi ɛwɔ Sarasvati Asubɔnten basin a seesei awe no mu no, ɛsɛ yɛfrɛ no Indus-Sarasvati Anibue, ebinom nso frɛ no Harappan Anibue na wɔde too Harappa,, wɔuu ne bea a edi kan no 1920s mu.

translation.en: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances.
translation.sw: Esiane sɛ na Roman aheman no mu asraafosɛm abusu nti ɛboa ma wɔnyaa nkcanim wɔ aduyɛ mu.

translation.en: Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles.
translation.sw: Kanifo Augustus fii ase faa Adɔkotfo adwuma mu na wɔtee Roman Medical Corps sɛ wɔnni dwuma wɔ ako no akyi.

translation.en: Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds.
translation.sw: Nnuyɛfo ‘Surgeons’ wɔ nimde wɔ nnuro ahorow a ɛma adwene no mmerɛ pii na ɛnyɛ adwuma pii ho a morphine a ɛfiri poppy aba mu scopolamine a ɛfi herbane aba mu.

translation.en: They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow.
translation.sw: Wɔbɛyɛɛ akunini wɔ twa wɔtwa obi akwaa bi fi hɔ no ho na abɔ nnipa no ho ban afi honam abɔre ho ne afiri wɔdde di dwuma ɛmma mogya nni afurusane ne ade wɔde di dwuma a ɛmma mogya na nkɔ mu.

translation.en: Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.
translation.sw: Mfe ha ha bi akyi no,Roman aheman no nyaa nkɔanim wɔ aduyu mu na ɛbɛyɛɛ nimde a ɛwɔ hɔ nnɛ no nnyinaso.

translation.en: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations.
translation.sw: Pureland origami yɛ origami nhyɛ da so sɛ folder biako pɛ na wɔtumi yɛ no bere koro mu, fold bere a ɛyɛ den te sɛ reverse fold wɔmma ho kwan, ɛnyɛ folds nyinaa na ɛwɔ mmeae a ɛyɛ tee.

translation.en: It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.
translation.sw: John Smith ina ɔyɛɛ no 1970s mu sɛ ɛmmoa wɔn a wɔyɛ folders a wɔnni suahunu pii no anaasɛ wɔn a motor skills nkɔ anim pii no.

translation.en: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior.
translation.sw: Mmɔfra nya nnipa a wɔyiyi wɔn mu ho adwene firi wɔn mmɔfra ase na saa nyiyimu yi ɛka nneyɛe.

translation.en: For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.
translation.sw: Sɛ nhwɛso no, mmɔfra nnipa mu nyinyimu nya wɔn so nkɛntɛnso no mmɔ mmɔden wɔ sukuu mu bere a wɔabɛhunu sɛ esiane wɔn abusuaku a wɔfi mu nti wɔyiyi wɔn mu no.

translation.en: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently.
translation.sw: MySpace ne wɛbsaete a ɛtɔ so abiɛsa a wɔde di dwuma pa ara wɔ United State na mprenmpren wɔn a wɔn ho nsɛm wɔ hɔ no yɛ ɔpepem 54.

translation.en: These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting.
translation.sw: Saa wɛbsaete weinom anya asrafoɔ pa ara, titiriw deɛ ɛfa nhomasua ho.

translation.en: There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features.
translation.sw: Nnoɔma pa bi wɔ wɛbsaet yi ho, deɛ ɛko bi ne, sɛ woreyɛ klass peegyi a wommerɛ a deɛ ɛbɛka ho bi ne blogs, vidio ahodoɔ, mfoni ne nnoɔma nkaeɛ.

translation.en: This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling.
translation.sw: Wonam wɛb adrɛse biako a wode bɛma so no wo nsa betumi aka, ɛma ɛyɛ mmerɛw sɛ wobɛkae na ɛma ɛyɛ mmerɛw ma wo sɛ wobɛtaapo ama asukuufoɔ a wɔbɛwɔ ɔhaw wɔ kiibɔdo a wɔde bedi dwuma ho anaa wɔwɔ ɔhaw wɔ sopɛɛlin ɛho no.

translation.en: It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.
translation.sw: Wɔbɛtumi ayɛ no kwan soronko bi so ɛbɛma ɛnyɛ den sɛ ɔbɛkenkan, na afei nso kɔla kakra anaa deɛ ɛnɔɔso sɛnea ɛsɛ.

translation.en: Attention Deficit Disorder "is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy".
translation.sw: Attention Deficit Disorder “neurological syndrome a ne klasek a ɛyɛ nsunsuanso a aka abom a impulsivity, distractibility ne hyperactivity anaasɛ ahoɔden mmoroso”.

translation.en: It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it "affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children".
translation.sw: Ɛnyɛ adesua mu dɛmdi, ɛyɛ adesua mu biribi a ɛnkɔ yiye; ɛka mmɔfra mu ɔha nkyekyɛmu 3 kɔsi 5, bɛyɛ Ameika mmɔfra bɛboro ɔpepem 2.

translation.en: Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation.
translation.sw: MMɔfra a wɔwɔ ADD no ntumi mfa wɔn adwene nsi sukuu dwumadi so, nanso wɔtumi de wɔn adwene si nneɛma wɔn ani gye ho so te sɛ wɔredi agoru anaasɛ sɛ wɔbɛhwɛ kaatoons a n’ani gye ho anaasɛ wɔbɛtwerɛtwerɛ kasamu a wɔmfa atwerɛmu agyinaehyɛde nni dwuma.

translation.en: These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they "engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods.
translation.sw: Mmɔfra weinom taa de wɔn to asɛm mu, esiane sɛ wɔde wɔn ho nneyɛe a ɛyɛ hu mu,wɔkɔ, ne wɔn a wɔkura tumi di anobaabae, esiane sɛ wɔn adwene mma wɔnhunu nneɛma ɛyɛ no.

translation.en: ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different.
translation.sw: ADD ɛka wɔne wɔn mfɛfo ntam nkitahodi esiane sɛ mmɔfra afoforo nte sɛ nti a wɔyɛ wɔn ade wɔ saa kwan no so anaasɛ sɛ nti wɔsopɛɛle saa kwan no anaasɛ wɔn nyini no da soronko.

translation.en: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed.
translation.sw: Sɛ ahoɔden a yɛde sua nimde na yɛde sua ade no sesa wɔ kwan bi so sɛnea wɔaka a ɛwɔ fam sene baabi a anka ɛsɛ ɛhyɛ ase ‘ base rate’ no a nimde a wɔanya no sesa.

translation.en: The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus.
translation.sw: Kwan a wɔnam so ma wɔn nsa nka nsɛm no yɛ soronko. Ɔyɛ biara nni ankorɛankorɛ so sɛ ɔnkae ade, nan mmom sɛ ɔbɛtumi akae tɛst bɛyɛɛ de wɔde ani sii so.

translation.en: In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.
translation.sw: Renaissance maa nsakrae a ɛhia baa kwan wɔfa sua ade na wɔkyekyɛ nimde no mu.

translation.en: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees.
translation.sw: Ɛnte sɛ primates nkae no, hominids mfa wɔn nsa nni dwuma wɔ locamotion mu bio anaasɛ wɔgyina wɔn anan so anaasɛ nsɔ dua mu nto adonko.

translation.en: The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking.
translation.sw: Akaatia nsa ne ne wɔn nan mu kɛse ne wɔn tenten sɛ, na ɛkyerɛ nsa a wɔde sɔ ade a emu yɛduru mu wɔ knuckle nante mu.

translation.en: The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges.
translation.sw: Nnipa nsa yɛ tia sene wɔn nan mu ɛwɔ dompe a ɛwɔ nsansoaa ne nannsoa.

translation.en: Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.
translation.sw: Fossil nsa mu dompe a adi mfe ɔpepem abien kɔ ɔpepem abiɛsa kyerɛ sɛnea wɔadane wɔn nsa locomotion kɔ manipulation.

translation.en: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting.
translation.sw: Nnipa pii gye di sɛ artificially induced lucid dae a obi bɛso pii no bɛtumi ayɛ ɔbrɛ.

translation.en: The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states.
translation.sw: Saa phenomenon yi boatae paa yi fi lucid dae a emu twe ɛwɔ REM siteeti ntam.

translation.en: With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem.
translation.sw: REMs kakraa bi a ɛwɔ hɔ anadwo no, ne tebea a wɔwom a ɛma woda ankasa yiye no ne wo honam ɛrekɔva no ntaa mma wonnya ɔhaw.

translation.en: This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV.
translation.sw: Wei yɛ berɛ te sɛnea ɛsɛ sɛ sima aduonu anaasɛ aduasa biara no wo sɔre hwɛ TV.

translation.en: The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.
translation.sw: Nsunsuanso no gyina sɛnea w’adwene no bɔ mmɔden dwene nneɛma ho anadwo ho da biara no.

translation.en: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya.
translation.sw: Nnoɔma a ankɔ yiye amma Italifo wɔ Afrika Atifi fam fiti mfiase no pɛɛ. Nnawɔtwe so bere a Italifo suae ɔko wɔ bosome Ayɛwohumumɔ da a ɛtɔ so 10, 1940, na Britainfoɔ Hussarfoɔ a wɔto so 11 no agye Fɔɔto Capuzzo abɔ so wɔ Libya

translation.en: In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci.
translation.sw: Britainfoɔ no kɔtɛɛ wuram na wɔtow hyɛɛ Italifoɔ Asrafo no so ɔkyeree Ngyinia panyin a ɔtɔ so du, Gyɛneral Lastucci.

translation.en: On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.
translation.sw: Da a ɛtↄ so 28 wↄ Ayɛwohumumo bosome no, Srani panyin Italo Balbo, a na ɔyɛ kandini wɔ Libya na ɔno na ɔbɛdi Mussolini ade no wui ɛnam atuo a ɛto fii ne nkurↄfo no hↄ a wↄnhyɛ da wↄ bere a na ɔresi wɔ Tobruk.

translation.en: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition.
translation.sw: Fencing agurɔ a aba so no wɔdi wɔ gyinapɛn biara, fi asuafo a wɔ sua ade wɔ suapɔn mu kosi animdefo so ne Olympic akansi mu.

translation.en: The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.
translation.sw: Nnipa abien abien na edi agurɔ no, ɔkofo biako ko tia ne yɔnko.

translation.en: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes.
translation.sw: Golf yɛ agorɔ bi a wɔn a wɔbɔ no de aporibaa bɔ bɔɔlo kɔ hyɛ tokuro mu.

translation.en: Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth.
translation.sw: Wɔ bɔ ntokuro dunwɔtwe sɛ ɛyɛ ɔfa a ɛnam ne kwan so a, na wɔn a wɔbɔ no tae fi ase bɔ wɔ tokuro a edi kan no mu akansi no mu na wɔ wie wɔ tokuro a ɛto so dunwɔtwe no mu.

translation.en: The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins.
translation.sw: Onipa a ɔbɔ dodow kakraa bi, anaa ɔhim aporibaa no kakraa bi de wie akansi no na ɔbedi nkonim.

translation.en: The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.
translation.sw: Wɔ bɔ wɔ sare so, na wɔ twa sare a ɛwɔ tokuro no ano no so ma no yɛ tia na wɔferɛ no ahabanmuno.

translation.en: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism.
translation.sw: Ebia nsrahwɛ ho nhwɛso a agye din paa no yɛ nea nkurɔfo de toto akwantu ho no: Ɔhome ho nsrahwɛ.

translation.en: This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun.
translation.sw: Wei yɛ bere a nkurɔfo kɔ beae bi a ɛda nsow wɔ wɔn daa-daa abrabɔ ho kɔ gye wɔn ahome na wogye wɔn ani.

translation.en: Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists.
translation.sw: Mpoano, turo ne nsraban mmeae yɛ mmeae a agyi din a nkurɔfo a wɔ kɔ nsrahwɛ no tae kɔ hwɛ hɔ.

translation.en: If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism.
translation.sw: Sɛ atrimpɔw a obi de kɔ sera beae bi ne sɛ ɔpɛ sɛ ohu beae no abakɔsɛm ne n’amammerɛ a ɛnde nsrahwɛ a ɛte saa no wɔferɛ no amammerɛ ho nsrahwɛ.

translation.en: Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.
translation.sw: Nsrahwɛfo no betumi akɔsera mmeae titiriw ahorow wɔ ɔman pɔteebi so anaa wɔbetumi apaw sɛ wɔbɛ ma wɔn ani akɔ beae biako pɛ so.

translation.en: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements.
translation.sw: Bere a Ɔman a na edi ɔman foforo no so no huu nea ɛrekɔso no, wɔferɛɛ se mmagum mera.

translation.en: Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals).
translation.sw: Asraafo dɔm a na wɔrehyɛ animkɔ gyinabea no so no na 1st ne 3rd Hampshire Foforo no dɔm a mmerima 200 wɔ mu no ka ho bi, wɔ Asafoahene John Stark ne James Reed ase (akyire no wɔn baanu no nyinaa bɛyɛɛ asafoahenekunini).

translation.en: Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position.
translation.sw: Stark mmerima no gyinaa wɔn gyinabea wɔ ban a na ɛwɔ Ɔman a na edi ɔman foforo so no gyinabea no nkyɛn wɔ atififam akyiri.

translation.en: When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach.
translation.sw: Bere a asorɔkye a aba fam no maa kwan bɛ daa Mystic Asubɔntene no ho wɔ peninsula a ɛwɔ atifi-apue fam no ho no, wɔ yɛɛ ntɛm de ɔbo ban tiatia terɛɛ ban no mu kɔɔ atififam akyiri hɔ wɔ nsuo no ano wɔ po ano ketewa no so.

translation.en: Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.
translation.sw: Gridley anaa Stark de dua a ne tenten bɛyɛ anamɔn 100 (30m) ato ban no anim na ɔhyɛɛ sɛ mma obiara ntow tuo kosi sɛ ɔman no asraafo kuo a wɔdi mu no hyɛ wɔn ansa.

translation.en: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions.
translation.sw: Amarica atrimpɔw no gyinaa sɛ wɔnam ɔkwan biako so bɛ to ahyɛ wɔn so efiri akwan ahorow mmiɛnsa so.

translation.en: General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements.
translation.sw: Ɔsahene John Cadwalder bɛtow ahyɛ Britain asraafodɔm a wɔwɔ Bordentown so de atwe wɔn adwene efiri ade titiriw no so, sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ a wɔ be siw mmagum biara kwan.

translation.en: General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping.
translation.sw: Ɔsahene James Ewing de ɔmanmufo a wɔn atetew wɔn tesɛ asraafo no mu 700 betwa asubɔntene a ɛwɔ Trenton Ferry no, wɔde wɔn nsa bɛto ɛtwene a ɛwɔ Assunpink Creek no atifi no na wɔbɛsiw atamfo no asraafodɔm biara kan sɛ wɔbɛ guan.

translation.en: The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.
translation.sw: Asraafokuw no mu titiriw a mmerima 2,400 wɔ mu no betwa asubɔntene no akɔ akwansin akrɔn wɔ Trenton atififam, na afei wɔbɛkyɛ wɔn mu mmienu na kuw biako bɛwɔ Greene ase na biako nso awɔ Sullivan ase, sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ a wɔbɛ tow ahyɛ wɔn so ahemadakye.

translation.en: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity.
translation.sw: Nsakrae a efiri nkyɛmu anan a aka wɔ akwansini fa mu mmirikatu no mu no, ahoɔhare bɛyɛ ade a ɛho nhia na amanehunumu boasetɔ bɛyɛ ade titiriw a ɛho hia paa.

translation.en: Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards.
translation.sw: Ɛwom s ɛ obi a ɔdi kan wɔ akwansini fa mu mmirikatu mu no betumi de simma mmienu awia a, ɛsɛ sɛ ɔyɛ obi a ne ho yɛ hare paa, nanso ɛsɛ ɔnya amanehunumu boasetɔ wɔ asiane nyinaa mu.

translation.en: Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.
translation.sw: Mmirika a wɔtu fa aman mu wɔ awɔbere mo, ne apomuteɛteɛ ho dwumedie a wɔyɛ ma nipadua no fa a ɛwɔ suro no a wɔka bɔmu no, yɛ ɔkwan pa a wɔ de yɛ ahoboa ma mmirikatu bere no.

translation.en: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness.
translation.sw: Aduandi a wo be didi yie nkoa rentumi mma wommɔ wo ho mmɔden yie wɔ akansi mu, nanso ebetumi aboa akansifo nkumaa ma wɔn apɔwmuden akɔ yie.

translation.en: Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.
translation.sw: Wɔn apɔmuden a wɔbɛma akari pɛ, nsuo a wɔbɛtae anom, ne nnuane nnuru nsiananmu ho ntease a edi mu a wɔbenya no betumi aboa akansifo ama wɔn mmɔdenbɔ anya nkɔanim na anigye a wɔwɔ ma agudie no nso akɔ anim.

translation.en: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate.
translation.sw: Kwansini ntam mmirikatu yɛ agudie a ne bo nyɛ den; nanso, nnsɛm a ɛnnyɛ nokware pii wɔ hɔ a ɛfa adwinnade a ɛho hia sɛ wonya na ama wo atumi de wo ho ahyɛ saa agudie yi mu.

translation.en: Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance.
translation.sw: Wobetumi atɔ neama a wo hia no, nanso emu pii benya nkɛntɛnso kakra anaa ɛrennya nkɛntɛnso biara wɔ wo mmɔdenmɔ so.

translation.en: Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.
translation.sw: Akansifo betumi ate nka sɛ wɔ hia ade bi abere mpo a ɛmfa mfaso biara ɛmma wɔn.

translation.en: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter.
translation.sw: Wɔbu atɔm sɛ ɛyɛ ade a ɛho hia wɔ ade biara mu no mu biako.

translation.en: Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1.
translation.sw: Bohr nhwɛso a asete nyɛ den no kyerɛ sɛ, ɛyɛ ade a ne ntease yɛ den, a ɛwɔ nucleus mfinfini a elentron pii twa ho hyia, biribi te sɛ sɛnea akyinsroma no twa owia no ho no - hwɛ mfonini 1.1.

translation.en: The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons.
translation.sw: Neama mmienu na ɛka bɔm na ɛyɛ nucleus no - neutron pii ne proton pii.

translation.en: Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.
translation.sw: Proton pii wɔ electric charge a ɛyɛ kotope abere a neutron pii nni charge biara. Electron pii no wɔ electric charge a ɛnyɛ kotope.

translation.en: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety.
translation.sw: Ansa na wobɛhwɛ onipa a wapira no, ɛsɛ sɛ wodi kan hwehwɛ beae hɔ yie de hwɛ sɛ asiane biara nni hɔ.

translation.en: You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags.
translation.sw: Ɛsɛ sɛ wohwɛ sɛnea onipa a wapira no da hɔ no bere a worebɛn no ne asiane biara a ebetumi asi ho nsɛnkyerɛne.

translation.en: If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.
translation.sw: Sɛ wopira bere a woreboa obi a, wobɛma neama agye nsam koraa.

translation.en: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers.
translation.sw: Nhwehwɛmu no huu sɛ adwenemhaw, ehu ne atoyerɛnkyɛm dii ayɔnkofa a ɛda ɔyaw ne dɛmdi a ɛwɔ sisi akyi mu yaw a wɔn a wɔyare saa yare no wɔ no ntam asɛm.

translation.en: Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions.
translation.sw: Atoyerɛnkyɛm ho nsonsuanso nkoaa na ɛnhwehwɛ sɛ wobekɔ PA asetra a wɔn ahyehyɛ no bere biara na ɛnyɛ adwenemhaw ne ehu.

translation.en: Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.
translation.sw: Wɔn a wɔyɛ daadaa dwumedie no hiaa mmoa pii wɔ adwene bɔne a na wɔwɔ fa nsonsonoe a ɛwɔ ɔyaw a ɛwɔ atenka koanokoro mu ne ateetee a ɛwɔ honam mu ahokeka mu no.

translation.en: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes.
translation.sw: Ade hu, anaa sɛ wobetumi ahu ade no gyina aniso adeyɛ ho akwanso atenka akwaa no so anaa ani no.

translation.en: There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism.
translation.sw: Ani sibea ahorow pii na ɛwɔ hɔ, a efiri sɛnea ɛyɛ nwonworann mu na agyina nkwanoa no ahiade so.

translation.en: The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.
translation.sw: Sibea ahorow a ɛwɔ hɔ no wɔ akwan ahorow a wɔtumi de yɛ adi, wɔwɔ wave-length ahorow ho atenka ne anoden ho dibeae ahorow, afei nso wɔ hia akwan ahorow a wɔfa so nya biribi ho ntease ne nkontahyɛde ahorow na w,ɔde ayɛ adwuma wɔ ɔkwan pa so.

translation.en: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area.
translation.sw: Ɔman bi mu fo yɛ nkwanmmoa titiriw bi kuw a wɔwɔ beae titiriw bi mu no.

translation.en: When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic.
translation.sw: Sɛ ankorankoro a wɔwɔ ɔman bi mu no di nsɛ wɔ su titiriw bi mu a wɔferɛ wɔn monomorphic.

translation.en: When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.
translation.sw: Sɛ ankorankoro no da su a ɛnnsɛ adi a wɔferɛ wɔn polymorphic.

translation.en: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well.
translation.sw: Asraafo ntatea kuw nantew na wɔyɛ berebu wɔ mmere ahorow mu ntwahohyia mu nso.

translation.en: In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day.
