translation.sw: Wɔ nomadic ntwahohyia bere mu no, asraafo ntatea nantew anadwo na wɔgyina gye wɔ ahome adekyee.

translation.en: The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday.
translation.sw: Ntatea kuw no firi nomadic ntwahohyia bere yi ase sɛ wɔn nnuan a wɔwɔ no so tew a. Wɔ saa ntwahohyia bere yi mu no, ntatea kuw no yɛ berebu a ɛntena hɔ nnkyɛ na wɔ sesa no dabiara da.

translation.en: Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.
translation.sw: Saa nomadic basabasayɛ anaa nante yi tena hɔ wɔ nna bɛyɛ 17 mu.

translation.en: What is a cell? The word cell comes from the Latin word "cella", meaning "small room", and it was first coined by a microscopist observing the structure of cork.
translation.sw: Dɛn ade ne nkwanmmoa? Asɛmfua nkwanmmoa firi Latin asɛmfua "cella" mu, a ɛkyerɛ "dan ketewa" na wɔdii kan nya firii nsati a wɔde hyɛɛ afiri a wɔde hwɛ neama nketewa paa no ase no.

translation.en: The cell is the basic unit of all living things, and all organisms are composed of one or more cells.
translation.sw: Nkwanmmoa no yɛ ade biako a ɛwɔ neama a nkwa wɔm mu, na nkwanmmoa biako anaa mmienu na ɛka bom yɛ neama a nkwa wɔmu nyinaa.

translation.en: Cells are so basic and critical to the study of life, in fact, that they are often referred to as "the building blocks of life".
translation.sw: Nkwanmmoa yɛ fapem na ɛho hia paa wɔ nkwa ho adesua mu, kyerɛ sɛ, wɔtae ferɛ wɔn "dufɔkye a wɔde si nkwa ".

translation.en: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed.
translation.sw: Nkate a ɛwɔ nnipadua mu a ɛkanyan no na ɛyɛ adwuma no kura homeostasis so denam atenka a apia fa nipadua no nyinaa mu na ama mogya atumi edi afrosane yie a hwee rensiw ne kwan.

translation.en: These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.
translation.sw: Saa nkate a apia fa nipadua mu no betumi de ntɛmpɛ aterɛw afa nipadua no mu na ɛboa bɔ nipadua no ho ban firi mpo bi a ebetumi aba mu no ho.

translation.en: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path.
translation.sw: Ahum tu wɔ beae ketewa bi na ɛnte sɛ mframa a ɛbɔ dennenen, nanso ebetumi sɛi biribiara a ɛwɔ ne kwan mu.

translation.en: Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours.
translation.sw: Ahum tu nnua ase, etu taabo firi adan ho, na ɛma ahyɛn tu kɔ wim. Ahum a edi awu ɔha mu nkyekyɛmu mu mmienu no mo tena hɔ bɛboro nnɔnhwerew mmiɛnsa.

translation.en: These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
translation.sw: Saa mframa a ɛbɔ dennenen a ɛho yɛ hu yi bɔ bɛyɛ ko du 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

translation.en: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years.
translation.sw: Nnipa yɛ nhwehwɛ na wɔde nhwehwɛ na ɛma neama yɛ akɛse bɛyɛ mfe mpem mpem beberee.

translation.en: However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century.
translation.sw: Nanso, adwinnade a wɔde hwɛ neama wɔ akyirikyiri no na wɔyɛ wɔ Europe wɔ 16th century akyiri.

translation.en: These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.
translation.sw: Saa adwinnade a wɔde hwɛ neama wɔ akyirikyiri yi kaa nhwehwɛ mmienu boomu na ɛtwee neama bɛne na ɛyɛɛ akɛse nso.

translation.en: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly
translation.sw: Anibere ne pɛsɛmenkomenya bɛwɔ yɛn nkyɛn bere nyinaa na ne nkabom a ɛne sɛ sɛ fa kɛse nya so mfaso a wɔbenya pii afiri mu wɔ mmere tia bi mu sɛ woyɛ neama wɔ pɛsɛmenkomenya kwan so a.

translation.en: Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.
translation.sw: Wɔ anidaso mu no, nnipa pii bɛba abɛ hu sɛ gyinae a ɛbɛ boa wɔn mmere tenten mu ne sɛ wɔne afoforo bɛyɛ adwuma abɔ mu.

translation.en: Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant.
translation.sw: Nkurɔfo pii so da a nnipa betumi atukwan akɔ nsoroma foforo so na wɔn akɔ hwɛ wiase foforo no, ebinom dwennwen nea ɛwɔ hɔ ho ebinom gyedi sɛ amanfrafo anaa ade foforo a nkwa wɔ mu te nsoroma foforo so.

translation.en: But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are "neighbors".
translation.sw: Nanso, sɛ eyi besi mpo a ɛnde ɛbɛkyɛ paa ansa na esi. Nsroma no ntam atete wɔ soro hɔ ma akwansin apepepepem na ɛwɔ nsoroma a wɔyɛ ‘afipamfo’ ntam.

translation.en: Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?
translation.sw: Ebia da koro bi, wo mma nananom bɛgyina amanfrafo wiase bi so adwennwen wɔn nananom a wɔtenaa ase tete no ho?

translation.en: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move.
translation.sw: Nkwanmoa pii na ɛwɔ mmoa mu. Wɔ di neama na wɔ yam wɔ wɔn nipadua no mu. Mmoa pii tumi keka wɔn ho.

translation.en: Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains).
translation.sw: Mmoa nkoaa na wɔwɔ adwene (nanso ɛnyɛ mmoa nyinaa na wɔwɔ bi; jellyfish, sɛ nhwɛso no, wɔnni adwene).

translation.en: Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.
translation.sw: Mmoa wɔ wiase yi mu babiara. Wɔtutu fam, wɔguare wɔ po mu. na wotu wɔ wim.

translation.en: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism.
translation.sw: Nkwanmoa yɛ abɔde (neama) a nkwa wɔmu no fa ketekete bi.

translation.en: Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room.
translation.sw: Asɛmfua nkwanmoa firi Latin asɛmfua cella mu a ɛkyerɛ dan ketewa.

translation.en: If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls.
translation.sw: Sɛ wohwe abɔde a nkwa wɔmu wɔ anwinade a wɔdehwɛ neama nketenkete ase a, wobɛhu sɛ ahinanan anaa bɔɔlo na ayɛ no ma.

translation.en: Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope.
translation.sw: Robert Hooke, a ɔsua abɔde ho ade a ɔfiri England, no huu ahinanan nketewa wɔ ntuaano mu wɔ anwinade a wɔdehwɛ neama nketenkete ase.

translation.en: They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells
translation.sw: Na ɛte sɛ adanmu. Ɔno ne nipa a odi kan a ɔhuu nkwanmoa a wɔn awuwu.

translation.en: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change.
translation.sw: Nnoɔma ne neama afrafra betumi afiri tebeae biako mu akɔ foforo mu a ɛrensesa sɛnea ɛte.

translation.en: Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same.
translation.sw: Nitrogen a ɛyɛ mframagya no daso wɔ su tesɛ nitrogen a ɛsen. Wɔ tebeae a ɛsen mu no ɛyɛ duru nanso molecules da so te sɛnea ɛte.

translation.en: Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.
translation.sw: Nsu yɛ nhwɛso foforo. Neama afrafraa a ɛwɔ nsu mu no yɛ hydrogen atɔm mmienu ne oxygen atɔm biako.

translation.en: It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid.
translation.sw: Saa ara na ɛte wɔ molecular yɛbeae mu ɛmfa ho sɛ ɛyɛ mframagya, ade a ɛsen, anaa ade a ɛyɛ den.

translation.en: Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.
translation.sw: Ɛmfa ho sɛ ne yɛbea a yɛhu no betumi asesa no, ne nnuru mu yɛbeae no te sɛnea ɛte.

translation.en: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand.
translation.sw: Mmere yɛ ade a atwa yen ho ahyia , na ɛnya biribiara so nsunsuanso, nanso ɛyɛ den sɛ yɛbɛte ase.

translation.en: Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years.
translation.sw: Nyamesomfo, nyansapɛfo, ne abɔde mu nyansapɛfo de mfe apepem pii na asua mmere ho ade.

translation.en: We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past.
translation.sw: Yɛnya mmere ho osuahu sɛ neama a ɛsisi tuatua so efiri daakye mu de fa nnɛ mu de kosi bere a atwam mu.

translation.en: Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events.
translation.sw: Mmere san nso yɛ sɛnea yɛde dwumadi be tenten (ade tenten) toto foforo ho.

translation.en: You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.
translation.sw: W’ankasa wobetumi ahyɛ mmere a ɛretwam agyirae denam hwɛ a wobɛhwɛ sɛnea dwumedi bi sisi tuatua so. Dwumedi a esisi tuatua so no yɛ ade a esi na ɛsan si biom.

translation.en: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos.
translation.sw: Kɔmputa a ɛwɔ hɔ nnɛ no wɔde danedane mfonini ne video mu.

translation.en: Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films.
translation.sw: Sinitwa a ɛyɛ kuntann no wobetumi ayɛ wɔ kɔmputa so, na sinitwa a ɛte saa no wɔde yɛ adwuma wɔ TV ne sini mu.

translation.en: Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.
translation.sw: Wɔtae de kɔmputa a ɛyɛ kuntann na etwa nnwom na wɔkeka ngyigye ahorow bɔ mu.

translation.en: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas.
translation.sw: Efiri bere tenten wɔ mfe ɔpepem akrɔn ne mfe ɔpepem aduonu bere mu no, na wɔgyedii sɛ nnipa a wɔdii kan tenaa New Zealand no yɛ Maorifo, a na nnoma akɛse a wɔferɛ wɔn moas na wɔkyere wɔn sɛ wɔkɔ ahayɛ a.

translation.en: The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society.
translation.sw: Nsɛm no san kyerɛɛ sɛ Maorifo no to firi Polynesia wɔ Great Fleet na wɔ bɛgyee New Zealand firi Moriorifo no nsam, na wɔbɛtee akuafo asafo.

translation.en: However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture.
translation.sw: Nanso no, adanse foforo kyerɛ sɛ na Moriorifo no yɛ Maori asase no fa kɛse mu fo a wɔfiri New Zealand kɔɔ Chathan Nsupɔ so, na wɔfiri ase yɛɛ wɔn neama foforo, amammerɛ a asomdwo wɔ mu.

translation.en: There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand.
translation.sw: Na abusuakuo foforo bi nso wɔ Chathan nsupɔ no so eyi yɛ Maorifoɔ a wɔtu firi New Zealand.

translation.en: They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out
translation.sw: Wɔferɛɛ wɔn ho Moriorifo na abenne die kakra wɔ hɔ na ewi ase no, wɔpopaa Moriorifo no firii hɔ.

translation.en: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures.
translation.sw: Ankorankoro a na wɔka ho bɛyɛ mfenhyia du bi no boaa yɛn ma yɛn ani sɔɔ nea yetumi yɛ ne nea yɛn ani gye ho bere a yɛsusu yɛn akwanside ne mpo nkuguodi ho no.

translation.en: While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization.
translation.sw: Abere a yɛretie ankorankoro sɛ wɔka wɔn ho, wɔn abusua, ne wɔn nhyehyɛe ho nsɛm no, yɛbɛnyaa nhumu a edi mu fa tete ho ne nnipa bi a wɔnyaa kuw no ho neama pa ne neama bɔne ho nkɛntɛnso.

translation.en: While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization.
translation.sw: Aberɛ a wore te obi abakɔsɛm ase no ɛnkyerɛ sɛ wote n'amammerɛ ase, anyɛ yie koraa no ɛboa nkurɔfo ma wɔnya baabi a wɔgyina wɔ kuw no mo abakɔsɛm ho adwene.

translation.en: While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization.
translation.sw: Abere a wɔ susu wɔn nkunimdi na wɔn nkuguodi ho no, ankorankoro ne kuw no mu fo a wɔgusu sua ade no nyinaa behu kuw no so mfaso, kuw no botaeɛ ne nea ɛma kuw no kɔ so.

translation.en: In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church.
translation.sw: Wɔ saa tebeae yi mu no, kae a wɔ kae adwuma ho suban a esisi atwam ne nkunimdi a ɛde bae no boaa nkuroɔfo ma wɔ buee kwan maa nsesae fofor ne nkyerɛkyerɛ foforo maa kuro no mu asɔre no.

translation.en: Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.
translation.sw: Saa nkunimdi ho asɛm yi maa nsakrae ho suro no kɔɔ fam, aber nso a na ɛreda daakye ho nsakrae adi wɔ wɔn mu.

translation.en: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution.
translation.sw: Akwan a ɛwɔ hɔ a yɛfa so siesie ɔhaw yɛ kwan a yɛfa so siesie ɔhaw a ɛka adwene ahorow anaa akwan ahorow bom de ano pomasiberɛ.

translation.en: The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information.
translation.sw: Deɛ na ɛhyɛ wɔn adwenem ara ne ntɛmso, nsɛm a edidiso ne pɛpɛɛpɛyɛ, afei nso bɛhunu nsɛmpɔ no yiye, de nhehyɛeɛ a ɛwɔ hɔ no reyɛ adwuma, boaboa nsɛm ano.

translation.en: The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong.
translation.sw: Ade biako a ɛho hia wɔ saa adwenesusu yi mu ne: mmuae a ɛteɛ biako pɛ na ɛwɔ hɔ. Wodwene anoyi abien pɛ ho: ɛne ɛwom anaa ɛnnim.

translation.en: This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures.
translation.sw: Saa kwan a yɛfa so dwene yi ne nyansahunu wɔ twaka anaa nhyehyɛe kwan pɔtee bi.

translation.en: People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.
translation.sw: Nnipa a wɔwɔ saa adwene wei tumi dwene kɔ akyi, wɔtumi kaekae nneɛma, di ɔhaw ho dwuma na wɔsu nyansahunu nhwehwɛmu hwɛ.

translation.en: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others.
translation.sw: Nnipa na ɛyɛ mmoa a wɔwɔ adom akyɛdeɛ a wɔ de hu nea afoforo dwene.

translation.en: That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire.
translation.sw: Eyi kyerɛ sɛ yetumi de yɛn adwene bu ne aafoforo susu ho, nea wɔn abɔ wɔ tirimu sɛ wɔbɛyɛ, nea wɔgyedi, nea wɔnim anaa nea wɔpɛ.

translation.en: Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions.
translation.sw: Nea ɛka saa neama a yɛtumi yɛ ho no, afoforo nsusui a yɛbɛte ase no ho hia paa. Ɛma yɛn kwan ma yɛtumi di neama a ɛsisi ma yɛhu a ɛho ntease yɛ akɛse no ho dwuma.

translation.en: For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car.
translation.sw: Sɛ nhwɛso no, sɛ ɛba sɛ wuhu sɛ obi repae hyɛn bi mfɛnsere a, wobetumi asusu sɛ ɔrebɔ mmɔden awia obi a ɔnnim no hyɛn.

translation.en: He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.
translation.sw: Wobɛbu no atɛn wɔ ɔkwan foforo so sɛ w’ayera ne hyɛn no nsafoa na ɛyɛ ɔno ankasa hyɛn na ɔrebɔ mɔden sɛ ɔbɛbu awura mu.

translation.en: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University).
translation.sw: MRI gyina abɔde ho nimdeɛ a wɔferɛ no nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) gyinapɛn so, na Felix Bloch ( ɔyɛ adwuma wɔ Stanford University) ne Edward Purcell (ofi Harvard University) na wɔ huu ho ade wɔ 1930s mu.

translation.en: In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals.
translation.sw: Wɔ saa resonance yi mu no,baabi a twebo wɔ ne akasafidie ho mframa ma atɔm de akasafidie ho adafitwa sɛnkyerɛne nketenkete ma.

translation.en: In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis.
translation.sw: Wɔ afe 1970 mu no, Raymond Damadian, a ɔyɛ oduruyɛfo ne nhwehwɛmu ho nyansapɛfo, huu nea enti a wɔde twebo ho dede ho mfonini yɛ adwinade a wɔde yɛ nyarewa mu nhwehwɛmu.

translation.en: Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI.
translation.sw: Mfe anan akyi no wɔde ɛho tumi mae, ɛno na na ɛyɛ wiase nyinaa tumi a edi kan a wɔde mae wɔ MRI adwumayɛ ho.

translation.en: In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.
translation.sw: Wɔ 1977 mu no, Dr. Damadian wie “nipadua-nyinaa” MRI nhwehwɛmu anwinade a edi kan no ho adwumayɛ, na ɔferɛɛ no ”Indomitable”.

translation.en: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others.
translation.sw: Nkɔmmɔbɔ a ɛnkɔ so wɔ berɛ baako mu no boa yi berɛ ma adwennwene ne sɛnea yɛne afoforo di.

translation.en: It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information.
translation.sw: Ɛma kwan ma asuafo tumi yɛ adwuma wɔ wɔn ankasa bere mu na wɔn ankasa di bere a wɔde yɛ ɔkasa ho nkyerɛkyerɛ so.

translation.en: In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998)
translation.sw: Nea ɛka ho no, anohwete kakra wɔ mmere a yebetumi de ayɛ adwuma no so. (Bremer, 1998)

translation.en: The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times.
translation.sw: Intanεt no ne wiase ntontan kɛse a yɛde yɛ adwuma no ma adesuafo kwan ma wɔnsa tumi ka nsɛm bere biara.

translation.en: Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.
translation.sw: Adesuafo nso betumi de wɔn nsɛmmisa ama akyerɛkyerɛfo bere biara wɔ da no mu na wɔbetumi ahwɛ kwan sɛ wɔbenya muae ntɛm, sen sɛ wɔbɛtwɛn akosi da foforo a wɔde behyia bio no.

translation.en: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn.
translation.sw: Ɔkwan a wɔfa so sua ade a ɛbae wɔ nnɛmmere yi mu akyi no ma yɛde yɛn ho firi nea obiara gye di sɛ ɛyɛ ho. Yenni ɔkwan pa biako a yɛfa so sua ade.

translation.en: In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented.
translation.sw: Nokware ne sɛ, yenni ade biako a ɛsɛ sɛ yɛ sua. Adesua kɔ so wɔ osuahunu a ɛkɔ so wɔ osuani no ne nimdeɛe a ɛda n'anim no.

translation.en: Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point.
translation.sw: Osuahunu a yɛwɔ nansa yi wɔ wankasa-yɛ ne nsɛm a yɛde ma, TV so dwumadi a agyina adesua so kyerɛ sa gyinapɛn yi.

translation.en: So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge.
translation.sw: Yɛn mu pii hwɛ TV so dwumedi a ɛma yɛhu sɛnea neama kɔ so anaa yɛnya osuahunu a yɛremfa yɛn ho nhyɛ mu anaa yɛremfa saa nimdeɛe no nyɛ adwuma.

translation.en: We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.
translation.sw: Yɛrentumi nnsiesie hyɛn, ensi nsuti wɔ yɛn dan akiyi, yɛrentu kwan ɛnkɔ Peru nkɔ hwɛ tete neama a asɛi, anaa yɛbɛ siesie yɛn fiepamfo dan.

translation.en: Thanks to undersea fiber optic cable links to Europe and broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having internet access.
translation.sw: Nnaase nkɔma nsu ase fiber optic cable links a ɛkɔ Europe ne broadband satellite no, Greenland man no wɔ so bi na emu nnipa bɛyɛ 93% na wɔwɔ wisae ntotan kɛse no so.

translation.en: Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi.
translation.sw: Wo ahɔhodan (sɛ wɔte ahɔhodan nketewa mu anaa wɔn ankasa wɔn fie) mu no wɔbetumi anya wifi anaa kɔmputa a ɛwɔ wiase ntontan kɛse no so, na ɛhɔ fo nyinaa wɔ wiase ntontan kɛse adan anaa mmeae bi a wɔwɔ amansan wifi.

translation.en: As mentioned above, though the word "Eskimo" remains acceptable in the United States, it is considered pejorative by many non-U.S. Arctic peoples, especially in Canada.
translation.sw: Sɛnea yɛaka dedaw no, ɛmfa ho sɛ w’agye asɛmfua “Eskimo” atom wↄ United States no, wↄ Canada no, arcticfo a wↄnnyɛ United Statesfo hu no sɛ ɛyɛ mpoatwa.

translation.en: While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners.
translation.sw: Ɛmfa ho sɛ wobɛte sɛ "Greenland" ↄmanfo no de asɛmfua no redi dwuma no, ɛsɛ sɛ wↄn a wↄyɛ ahↄho gyae sɛ wↄbɛyɛ saa.

translation.en: The native inhabitants of Greenland call themselves Inuit in Canada and Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), a Greenlander, in Greenland.
translation.sw: Wↄn a wofi Greenland no frɛ wↄn ho Inuit ne kalaalleg (dodow kabea:kalaallit) wↄ Canada, nanso wↄn man mu de, wↄfrɛ wↄn Greenlandfo.

translation.en: Crime, and ill-will toward foreigners in general, is virtually unknown in Greenland. Even in the towns, there are no "rough areas."
translation.sw: Wɔ Greenland no, wonnim sɛ sɛnea wɔbɛyɛ ahɔho bɔne anaa wɔbɛdwen ne ho adwen bɔne. Wɔ kuro no mu mpo, "baabi a ɛhɔ nyɛ" nni hɔ.

translation.en: Cold weather is perhaps the only real danger the unprepared will face.
translation.sw: Awɔw ne tebea a ɛnyɛ a onii a ɔmmoaboaa ne ho no behyia.

translation.en: If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing.
translation.sw: Sɛ wokɔ Greenland awɔw mmere mu a (bere a worekɔ atifi fam no, na awɔw no mu reyɛ den), ɛho hia sɛ wode ntade a ɛka hye ba.

translation.en: The very long days in the summer can lead to problems getting sufficient sleep and associated health issues.
translation.sw: Kyɛ a wobɛkyɛ wɔ ɔhyew mmere mu no betumi ama wo nna ho aba asɛm na woanya apɔmuden mu haw so.

translation.en: During the summer, also watch out for the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any diseases, they can be irritating.
translation.sw: Sɛ ɔhyew mmere ba a, hwɛ wo ho yie wɔ Nordic ntontom ho. Ɛmfa ho sɛ wɔmmma yare biara no, wotumi ha adwen paa.

translation.en: While San Francisco's economy is linked to it being a world-class tourist attraction, its economy is diversified.
translation.sw: Bere a San Francisco sikasɛm ka ne yɛ a ɛyɛ wiase-gyinapɛn a edi mu nsrahwɛbeae, ne sikasɛm gu ahorow.

translation.en: The largest employment sectors are professional services, government, finance, trade, and tourism.
translation.sw: Adwumayɛ ɔfa kɛse no yɛ animdefo ɔsom nnwuma, aban, sikasɛm, aguadi ne nsrahwɛ.

translation.en: Its frequent portrayal in music, films, literature and popular culture has helped make the city and its landmarks known throughout the world.
translation.sw: Sɛnea ɛda ne ho adi wɔ nnwom mu, sini mu, kasadwini ne amammerɛ a agye din no aboa ma wɔm ahu kuro no ne n’asase so ahyɛnsode wɔ wiase nyinaa.

translation.en: San Francisco has developed a large tourist infrastructure with numerous hotels, restaurants, and top-notch convention facilities.
translation.sw: San Francisco ayɛ nsrahwɛbea mpontu kɛse ne ahɔhodan, adidi meae ne nhyiamu meae a ɛyɛ papa paa bebree.

translation.en: San Francisco is also one of the best places in the nation for other Asian cuisine: Korean, Thai, Indian, and Japanese.
translation.sw: San Francisco nso yɛ mmea papapaa no mu biako wɔ ɔman no mu ma Asiafo nnuane ahorow: Koreafo, Thaifo,Indiafo, ne Japanfo.

translation.en: Traveling to Walt Disney World represents a major pilgrimage for many American families.
translation.sw: Kwan a wɔtu kɔ Walt Disney Wiase no gyina hɔ ma akwantu titiriw ma Americafo mmusua beberee.

translation.en: The "typical" visit involves flying into Orlando International Airport, busing to an on-site Disney hotel, spending about a week without leaving Disney property, and returning home.
translation.sw: Ewiemuhyɛn mu tena d ewura Orlando Amanaman Wimhyɛn gyinabeae mu, Disney ahɔhodan a enni adagye, wo bedi bɛyɛ nnawɔtwe a woremmfi Disney agyapade, ne sɛ wosan w'akyi kɔ fie no ka nsrahwɛ "ankasa" ho.

translation.en: There are infinite variations possible, but this remains what most people mean when they talk of "going to Disney World".
translation.sw: Nsonsonoe a enni ano a ɛbɛyɛ yie pii wɔ hɔ, nanso eyi ne nea nkurɔfo kyerɛ sɛ wɔka "Disney Wiase kɔ" ho asɛm a.

translation.en: Many tickets sold online through auction websites such as eBay or Craigslist are partially used multi-day park-hopper tickets.
translation.sw: Akwannya nkrataa bebree a wɔtɔn wɔ abɛɛfo ntontan so denam badwam adetɔn wɛbsyte te sɛ eBay anaa Craigslist yɛ multi-day park-hopper akwannya nkrataa a wɔde di dwuma wɔ nyiyimu kwan so.

translation.en: While this is a very common activity, it is prohibited by Disney: the tickets are non-transferable.
translation.sw: Bere a eyi yɛ dwumadi a obiara nim no, Disney abara no: worentumi mfa akwannya krataa no mma obi foforo.

translation.en: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit.
translation.sw: Sɛ wopɛ sɛ woda ntamadan mu wↄ 'Grand Canyon' hye no akyi a, ɛbehia sɛ wonya tumi krataa a wↄde kↄ nkurow nketewa a ɛwↄ akyiri no bi.

translation.en: Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month.
translation.sw: Wↄde tumi krataa kakraa bi pɛ ma sɛnea ɛbɛbↄ canyon no ho ban, na wo nsa betumi aka krataa yi bosome no da a edi kan, abosome anan ansa na saa bosome no mfiase.

translation.en: Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan.
translation.sw: Eyi nti, ↄpɛpↄn da a edi kan na wobenya tumi krataa a wↄde kↄ nkurow nketewa (backcountry) ansa na woatumi akↄ hↄ kotonimma bosome mu.

translation.en: Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations.
translation.sw: Baabi a wosi ntamadan da mu a agye din bi te sɛ "Bright Angel Campground" a ɛbɛn "Phantom Ranch" no taa yɛ ma ntɛm, da a edi kan a wↄma kwan sɛ nsrahwɛfo betumi abegye ato hↄ no.

translation.en: There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.
translation.sw: Tumi krataa a ɛwↄ hↄ ma wↄn a wↄba hↄ bɛgye no yɛ kakraa bi; nea odi kan ba na onya.

translation.en: Entering Southern Africa by car is an amazing way to see all the region's beauty as well as to get to places off the normal tourist routes.
translation.sw: Hyɛn a wɔde wura Africa Anafofam yɛ anwanwa kwan a wode behu ɔmantam no ahoɔfɛ nyinaa ne afei nso sɛ wobɛkɔ mmeae a atwe ne ho afiri nsrahwɛ kwan a wɔnim no daa no so.

translation.en: This can be done in a normal car with careful planning but a 4x4 is highly advised and many locations are only accessible with a high wheel base 4x4.
translation.sw: Wobetumi ayɛ eyi wɔ hyɛn biara sɛ woyɛ ahwɛyie ho nhyehyɛe a nanso 4×4 na wɔ kamfo paa na 4×4 nkoaa na etumi akɔ mmeae pii.

translation.en: Keep in mind while planning that although Southern Africa is stable not all neighboring countries are.
translation.sw: Bere a woyɛ nhyehyɛe no fa hyɛ w’adwenem sɛ ɛmfa sɛ Africa Anaafofam adwo na ɛnyɛ aman a atwa ho ahyia no nyinaa na ɛte saa.

translation.en: Visa requirements and costs vary from nation to nation and are affected by the country you come from.
translation.sw: Visa ho ahiade ne ne bo da nsow efiri ɔman biako mu kɔ ɔman foforo mu na ɔman a wofiri mu no nya so nkɛntɛnso.

translation.en: Each country also has unique laws requiring what emergency items need to be in the car.
translation.sw: Ɔman biara nso wɔ mmra soronko a ɛhwehwɛ sɛ wonya mprofiri mu akwanhyia ho neama wɔ wo hyɛn mu.

translation.en: Victoria Falls is a town in the western portion of Zimbabwe, across the border from Livingstone, Zambia, and near Botswana.
translation.sw: Victoria Falls yɛ kuro a ɛwɔ Zimbabwe atɔefam, ɛtwa ɔhye no firi Livingstone, Zambia, ne ɛbɛn Bostwana.

translation.en: The town lies immediately next to the falls, and they are the major attraction, but this popular tourist destination offers both adventure seekers and sightseers plenty of opportunities for a longer stay.
translation.sw: Kuro no da nsu a ɛworow no nkyɛn pɛɛ, na wɔyɛ ade a ɛtwe adwene titiriw, nanso nsrahwɛbeae yi ma wɔn wɔhwɛ ade kwan ne adehwɛfo nyinaa na ɛma wɔn hokwan bebree sɛ wɔbɛtena hɔ akyɛ.

translation.en: In the rainy season (November to March), the water volume will be higher and the Falls will be more dramatic.
translation.sw: Wɔ nsutɔbere mu no (Obubuo kosi Ɔbenem), nsu no dodow bɛkɔ soro na Nsu a ɛworow no bɛyɛ nea ɛkyɛn so paa.

translation.en: You are guaranteed to get wet if you cross the bridge or walk along the trails winding near the Falls.
translation.sw: Yɛhyɛ wo bɔ sɛ wo ho bɛfɔw sɛ wo twa ɛtwene no anaa sɛ wonantew tentene no so wɔ nsu a ɛworow no ho a.

translation.en: On the other hand, it is precisely because the volume of water is so high that your viewing of the actual Falls will be obscured—by all the water!
translation.sw: Wɔ ɔkwan foforo so no, ade titiriw nti a ɛte saa ne sɛ nsu no volume no wɔ soro dodo ma worenhu sɛnea Falls no te ankasa - wɔ nsu no nyinaa!

translation.en: Tomb of Tutankhamun (KV62). KV62 may be the most famous of the tombs in the Valley, the scene of Howard Carter's 1922 discovery of the almost intact royal burial of the young king.
translation.sw: Tutankham ɔboda (KV62), KV62 bɛyɛ ɔboda a ɛwɔ agye din wɔ Bɔnka no mu, beae a Howard Carter 1922 adiyi a ɛfa ɔhene kumaa adehye ayi no ho no.

translation.en: Compared to most of the other royal tombs, however, the tomb of Tutankhamun is barely worth visiting, being much smaller and with limited decoration.
translation.sw: Sɛ wɔde toto adehye ɔboda a aka no ho a, nkantom mu no, Tutankhamun ɔboda ntae mfata sɛ woka sra, esiane sɛ esua paa na ɛhɔ nsiesie nso ɔhye da ho.

translation.en: Anyone interested in seeing evidence of the damage to the mummy done during attempts to remove it from the coffin will be disappointed as only the head and shoulders are visible.
translation.sw: Obiara a n'anigye ho sɛ obehu adanse a ɛfa efunu a wɔn akora so a ɛsɛi bere a wɔyɛe sɛ wobeyi no afi funu adaka no mu no bɛnya huammɔdi esiane sɛ ne ti ne ne mmati pɛ na wɔhu.

translation.en: The fabulous riches of the tomb are no longer in it, but have been removed to the Egyptian Museum in Cairo.
translation.sw: Ɔboda no mu ahonyade a ɛyɛ nwonwa no nni mu bio, mmom no wɔn ayi akɔ Egyptfo Tete neama akorae wɔ Cairo.

translation.en: Visitors with limited time would be best to spend their time elsewhere.
translation.sw: Ahɔho a wɔn bere sua no ɛbɛyɛ papa sɛ wɔbɛsɛe wɔn bere wɔ baabi foforo.

translation.en: Phnom Krom, 12 km southwest of Siem Reap. This hilltop temple was built at the end of the 9th century, during the reign of King Yasovarman.
translation.sw: Phnom Krom, 12 km anaafo-atɔefam wɔ Siem Reap. Wosii saa nkoko so asɔredan yi wɔ 9th century awie, bere a Ɔhene Yasovarman redi ade no.

translation.en: The gloomy atmosphere of the temple and the view over the Tonle Sap lake make the climb to the hill worthwhile.
translation.sw: Asɔredan no wim tebea a ɛyɛ kusuu ne ɔhwɛ a ɛwɔ Tonle Sap ɔtare no so no ma nkoko no foro yɛ nea mfaso wɔ so.

translation.en: A visit to the site can be conveniently combined with a boat trip to the lake.
translation.sw: Nsrahwɛ kɔ bea hɔ no wobetumi de ɔkoro so akwantu aka ho a ɔhaw biara mma.

translation.en: The Angkor Pass is needed to enter the temple so do not forget to bring your passport along when heading to Tonle Sap.
translation.sw: Angnkor Pass no hia sɛ wobetumi awura asɔredan no mu a ɛno nti mma wowerɛ mfi sɛ wode wo akwantu ho nkrataa bɛka wo ho sɛ worekɔ Tonle Sap a.

translation.en: Jerusalem is the capital and largest city of Israel, though most other countries and the United Nations do not recognize it as Israel's capital.
translation.sw: Jerusalem yɛ Isreal ahenkuro ne kuro kɛse, ɛmfa ho sɛ aman afoforo ne Aman Nkabom no mmu no sɛ ɛyɛ Isreal ahenkuro.

translation.en: The ancient city in the Judean Hills has a fascinating history spanning thousands of years.
translation.sw: Tete kuro a ɛwɔ Judean Nkoko no so no wɔ abakɔsɛm a ɛyɛ anika mfe apem a atwam yi mu.

translation.en: The city is holy to the three monotheistic religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam, and serves as a spiritual, religious, and cultural center.
translation.sw: Kuro no yɛ kronkron ma nyamesomfo a wɔgye onyame biakopɛ di asom abiɛsa no - Judafosom, Kristofosom ne Islamfosom, na ɛsom sɛ honhom, nyamesom ne amammerɛ mfimfini.

translation.en: Due to the religious significance of the city, and in particular the many sites of the Old City area, Jerusalem is one of the main tourist destinations in Israel.
translation.sw: Esiane nyamesom ho mfaso a ɛwɔ kuro no ho nti, ne titiriw no Kuro Dedaw no mmeae a ɛdɔɔso wɔ mpɔtam hɔ no, Jerusalem yɛ mmeae atitiriw a nsrahwɛfo kɔ sera wɔ Isreal no mu biako.

translation.en: Jerusalem has many historic, archeological and cultural sites, along with vibrant and crowded shopping centers, cafés, and restaurants.
translation.sw: Jerusalem wɔ abakɔsɛm, atetesɛm ne amammerɛ mmeae pii, ne aguadi meae a ɛyɛ ahokeka na nnipa abɔ apee so wɔ, anonnebeae, ne adidibeae.

translation.en: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens receive an invitation letter prior to entering Ecuador through international airports or frontier admission points.
translation.sw: Ecuador hwehwɛ sɛ Cuban manfo benya nsato krataa ansa na wɔn aba Ecuador denam amanaman ewimhyɛn gyinabea anaa kurotia akwannya beae.

translation.en: This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements.
translation.sw: Ɛsɛ sɛ Ecuadorfo Asoafohwɛfo ma Amanfoforo so Nsem no gye nkrataa yi tom wɔ mmra kwan, na ɛsɛ sɛ wo ne wɔn yɛ adwene wɔ ahwehwɛde bi ho.

translation.en: These requirements are designed to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries.
translation.sw: Wɔn asiesie saa ahwehwɛde yi sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ a ɛbɛ ma wɔn asraafo akɔ ne aba a nhyehyɛe da ho wɔ aman abien no ntam.

translation.en: Cuban citizens who are US green card holders should visit an Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement.
translation.sw: Cuban manfo a wɔyɛ nkurɔfo a wɔwɔ US green kaade no ɛsɛ sɛ wɔ kɔ Ecuadorfo Consulate hɔ sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ a wɔbɛyi saa ahwehwɛde yi efiri mu ama wo.

translation.en: Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. A round/onward trip ticket is needed to prove the length of your stay.
translation.sw: Ԑsԑ sԑ wo paspͻt no di mu na ԑboro nna a akwantu no bedi no so abosome 6.Wohia tekiti a etumi de wo kͻ na ԑsan de wo ba anaa tekiti a ebedi nna a wobedi no ho adanse.

translation.en: Tours are cheaper for larger groups, so if you're by yourself or with just one friend, try to meet other people and form a group of four to six for a better per-person rate.
translation.sw: Nnipakuw nsrahwԑ bo yԑ fo, enti sԑ ԑyԑ wo pԑ anaasԑ wo ne adamfo baako pԑ no, bͻ mmͻden sԑ mobehyia nnipa afoforo na moayԑ kuw a nnipa anan kosi nsia wom ama ͻbaakofo bo aba fam.

translation.en: However, this shouldn't really be off your concern, because often tourists are shuffled around to fill the cars.
translation.sw: Nanso, ԑnsԑ sԑ wei ha wo, esaine sԑ mpԑn pii no wͻka nsrahwԑfo no bom sԑnea kaa ahorow no bԑyԑ ma.

translation.en: It seems actually to be more a way of tricking people into believing they have to pay more.
translation.sw: Ԑte sԑ nea wͻde daadaa nkurofo ma ԑyԑ wͻn sԑ wobetua sika pii no.

translation.en: Towering above the north end of Machu Picchu is this steep mountain, often the backdrop to many photos of the ruins.
translation.sw: Bepɔw a emu dɔ na ɛware bi wɔ Machu Picchu atifi fam awiei hɔ, mpɛn pii no wobehu sɛ ɛwɔ amanfo no mfonini akyi.

translation.en: It looks a bit daunting from below, and it is a steep and difficult ascent, but most reasonably fit persons should be able to make it in about 45 minutes.
translation.sw: Ɛte sɛ nea ɛyɛ den bere a wogyina ase no, na emu dɔ na ɛyɛ den sɛ wobɛforo akɔ soro, nanso nnipa a wɔwɔ ahoɔden betumi de sima 45 aforo akɔ soro.

translation.en: Stone steps are laid along most of the path, and in the steeper sections steel cables provide a supporting handrail.
translation.sw: Wɔde aboɔ ayɛ anammɔnkwan no atrapoe no mu dodow no ara, na wɔ baabi a emu dɔ no, wɔde dade ayɛ nea woso mu de foro kɔ soro.

translation.en: That said, expect to be out of breath, and take care in the steeper portions, especially when wet, as it can become dangerous quickly.
translation.sw: Wɔ nea yɛaka yi mu no, hwɛ kwan sɛ wohome bԑte, na hwɛ wo ho yie wɔ baabi a emu dɔ, ne titiriw no bere a woafɔ, esaine sɛ ebetumi ayɛ hu nti.

translation.en: There's a tiny cave near the top that must be passed through, it is quite low and a rather tight squeeze.
translation.sw: Ɔbodan ketewa bi bɛn soro hɔ a ɛsɛ sɛ wofa mu, emu sua kakra na ɛsɛ sɛ wo mia wo ho fa mu.

translation.en: Seeing the sites and wildlife of the Galapagos is best done by boat, just as Charles Darwin did it in 1835.
translation.sw: Sɛ worekɔhwɛ beae ahorow ne mmoa ne mfude wɔ Galapogos a, ɛbɛyɛ papa sɛ wode ͻkorow bԑyԑ saa, sԑnea Charles Darwin yɛe wɔ 1835 mu no.

translation.en: Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers.
translation.sw: Po so ahyɛn bɛboro 60 na ɛfa Galapagos nsu no so - a wotumi fa nnipa dodow fi 8 kosi 100.

translation.en: Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season).
translation.sw: Nnipa dodoɔ no ara di kan kora baabi a wɔbenya no so (esaine sɛ korow no taa yɛ ma wɔ bere a nnipa ba hͻ paa no).

translation.en: Be sure the agent through whom you book is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of ships.
translation.sw: Hwɛ hu sɛ onii a wobɛfa ne so akora no yɛ Galapagos nimdefo a ɔwɔ ahyɛn ahorow ho nimdeɛ.

translation.en: This will ensure that your particular interests and/or constraints are matched with the ship most suitable to them.
translation.sw: Wei bɛma woagyina nea w'ani gye ho ne nea wompɛ so apaw po so hyɛn a ɛne no behyia.

translation.en: Before the Spanish arrived in the 16th century, northern Chile was under Inca rule while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche) inhabited central and southern Chile.
translation.sw: Ansa na Spainfo no reba wɔ afeha a ɛtɔ so 16 mu no, na Incafo no di Chile atifi fam no so, bere a kuromma a wɔfrɛ wɔn Araucanians (Mapuche) no te Chile mfimfini ne anaafo fam.

translation.en: The Mapuche were also one of the last independent American indigenous groups, that were not fully absorbed into Spanish-speaking rule until after Chile's independence.
translation.sw: Mapuchefo no yɛ tete Amerikafo kuw a wɔade wɔn ho no mu baako a woanfa wɔn ho anhyɛ wɔn a wɔka Spainfo kasa no tumidi ase kosi bere a Chile nyaa fawohodi.

translation.en: Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (amid the Napoleonic wars that left Spain without a functioning central government for a couple of years), decisive victory over the Spanish was not achieved until 1818.
translation.sw: Ɛmfa ho sɛ Chile nyaa fawohodi wɔ 1810 (bere a Napoleon ko no maa Spain bɛdaa hɔ a na onni aban a edi so bɛyɛ mfe bi no), wɔantumi anye wɔn ho amfi Spainfo no nsam kosi 1818.

translation.en: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti
translation.sw: Dominican Republic (Spainfo kasa: Republica Dominicana) yɛ Caribbeanfo kurow a ɛda hispaniola apuei mantam, na ɛne Haiti na ɛbↄ hye.

translation.en: Besides white sand beaches and mountain landscapes, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo.
translation.sw: Sɛ yɛde ne mpoano a anwea fitaa ayɛ so ma ne mmepↄw a atwa ho ahyia no to nkyɛn a,ɛhↄ na wubehu Europe kuro kɛse a akyɛ yie wↄ Americas hↄ, a seesei ɛka San Domingo ho no.

translation.en: The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE.
translation.sw: Tainofo ne Caribbeanfo na wodii kan bɛtenaa supↄw no so. Na caribbeanfo no ka Arawakan kasa, na wↄbaa hↄ wↄ afe 10,000(mpem du) ansa na yɛn bere yi mu.

translation.en: Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors
translation.sw: Wↄ abɔrehufo a wofi Europe no mmae mfe kakra bi akyi no, spainfo a wobedii tainofo no so no maa wↄn dodow so tee koraa.

translation.en: Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.
translation.sw: Sɛnea Fray Bartolome de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) kyerɛ no, efi afe 1492 kosi 1498 mu no, spainfo a wobedii wↄn so no kumkum Tainofo bɛyɛ 100,000.

translation.en: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building.
translation.sw: Jardin de la Union. Wɔyɛɛ saa beae yi sɛ asa maa ahotefo fie no wɔ afeha a ɛtɔ so 17, nanso Templo de San Diego pɛ ne dan a aka si hɔ.

translation.en: It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night.
translation.sw: Seesei wɔde ɛhɔ ayɛ aguadibea kɛse, na dwumadi kɔ so wɔ hɔ bere biara, ɛda no mu ne anadwo.

translation.en: There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo.
translation.sw: Adidibea ahorow etwa turo no ho ahyia , wɔyɛ kɔnsɛte a wonnye hwee awiabere ne anwummere biara fi central gazebo.

translation.en: Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend.
translation.sw: Callejon del Beso (Mfeano kwan). Abranaa mmienu a kwan a ɛda ntam yɛ sɛntimita 69 yɛ tete ɔdɔ ho anansesɛm fie.

translation.en: For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.
translation.sw: Sɛ woma mmofra bi sika ketewa bi a, wɔbɛka anansesɛm yi akyerɛ wo.

translation.en: Bowen Island is a popular day trip or weekend excursion offering kayaking, hiking, shops, restaurants, and more.
translation.sw: Bowen supɔw no yɛ da mu akwantu anaa nnawɔtwe awiei nsrahwɛ a wɔka kayak wɔ nsu so, wɔtwa kwan tenten, sotɔɔ ahorow wɔ hɔ, adidibea ahorow ne bebree a ɛka ho.

translation.en: This authentic community is located in Howe Sound just off Vancouver, and is easily accessed via scheduled water taxis departing Granville Island in downtown Vancouver.
translation.sw: Saa mpɔtam ɛda mu fua wɔ Howe Sound a ɛne Vancouver ntam nware na ɛnyɛ den sɛ wode kodoɔ a efi Granville supɔw no so wɔ Vancouver kuro no mu.

translation.en: For those who enjoy outdoor activities, a trek up the Sea to Sky corridor is essential.
translation.sw: Wɔn nso a wɔpɛ anigyede a wɔyɛ no abɔnten no, ebehia sɛ wɔnantew fa abrannaa a ɛwɔ wim a ɛfa ɛpo no so.

translation.en: Whistler (1.5 hour drive from Vancouver) is expensive but well-known because of the 2010 Winter Olympics.
translation.sw: Whistler (wode kaa fi Vancouver rekɔ hɔ yɛ nnɔnhwerew 1.5) bo yɛ den yiye nanso agye din paa esaine 2010 Olympics a wɔyɛ no awɔw bere mu no nti.

translation.en: In the winter, enjoy some of the best skiing in North America, and in the summer try some authentic mountain biking.
translation.sw: Wɔ awɔw bere mu no, nya ski a wɔde hyɛ nan ase sane fa bepɔw a sukyerɛma wɔ so wɔ North America mu mfaso, na wɔ ɔhyew bere mu no sɔ bepɔw so sakre twi a ɛda mu fua no hwɛ.

translation.en: Permits must be reserved in advance. You must have a permit to stay overnight at Sirena.
translation.sw: Ɛsɛ sɛ wodi kan gye akwammisa krataa to hɔ. Ɛsɛ sɛ wonya akwanmisa krataa ansa na woatumi atena Sirena ma ade kye.

translation.en: Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory lodging and hot meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer only camping with no food service.
translation.sw: Sirena nko ara ahomegyebea abammɔfo atenae a ɛma adan a wobɛda mu ne aduane a ɛyɛ hye ka beae a wobetumi asoeɛ wɔ abɔnten no ho. La Leona, San Pedrillo, ne Los Patos ma beae a wobetumi asoeɛ wɔ abɔnten a aduane nka ho.

translation.en: It is possible to secure park permits directly from the Ranger Station in Puerto Jiménez, but they do not accept credit cards
translation.sw: Wobetumi anya ahomegyebea akwammisa krataa tee efi wɔn a wɔbɔ hɔ ban no atennae wɔ Puerto Rico Jiménez, nanso wɔnnye kaade a wɔde tua ade ka no.

translation.en: The Park Service (MINAE) does not issue park permits more than one month in advance of anticipated arrival.
translation.sw: Ahomegyebea Adwumakuw (MINAE) remma wo akwammisa krataa bosome baako ansa na da a wobɛba no aduru so.

translation.en: CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service for a fee of US$30, or $10 for one-day passes; details on their Corcovado page.
translation.sw: CafeNet El Sol gye US$30 na woama wo hokwan sɛ wobetumi akora akwammisa krataa so, anaa $10 sɛ wopɛ sɛ wohwɛ hɔ da mu no a; ɛho nsɛm pii wɔ wɔn Corcovado afa hɔ.

translation.en: The Cook Islands are an island country in free association with New Zealand, located in Polynesia, in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean.
translation.sw: Cook Islands yɛ supɔw man a ɛne New Zealand ntam yɛ, a ɛwɔ Polynesia, wɔ South Pacific Ocean no mfinfini.

translation.en: It is an archipelago with 15 islands spread out over 2.2 million km2 of ocean.
translation.sw: Ɛyɛ supɔwkuw a supɔw 15 a apete afa ɛpo no so bɛboro ɔpepem 2.2 km² na ɛwɔ mu.

translation.en: With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes thought of as "Hawaii down under".
translation.sw: Esaine sɛ wɔne Hawaii da beae koro no nti, ɛtɔ da a wɔfrɛ wɔn “Hawaii ase hɔ”.

translation.en: Though smaller, it reminds some elderly visitors of Hawaii before statehood without all the large tourist hotels and other development.
translation.sw: Ɛmfa ho sɛ esua no, Hawaii nsrahwɛfo a wɔn mfe akɔ anim no kae bere a etwam a na enni nsrahwɛ ahɔhogyebea akɛse ne nkɔanim ahorow.

translation.en: The Cook Islands do not have any cities but are composed of 15 different islands. The main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki.
translation.sw: Cook Island nni nkuro ahorow mmom no ɛyɛ supɔw ahorow 15 a aka abom.Nea edi mu akoten ne Rarotonga ne Aittutaki.

translation.en: In developed countries today, providing deluxe bed and breakfasts has been raised to a sort of art-form.
translation.sw: Wɔ aman a akɔ wɔn anim mu no, wɔama nhyehyɛe a wɔayɛ sɛ wobenya mpa ne anɔpa aduane papa a ne bo yɛ den no abɛyɛ biribi a obiara di akyi.

translation.en: At the top end, B&Bs obviously compete mainly on two main things: bedding and breakfast.
translation.sw: Wɔ ne fa kɛse no ara mu no, wɔn a wɔyɛ B&B no si akan wɔ nneɛma mmienu ho: mpa a wobɛda so ne anɔpa aduane.

translation.en: Accordingly, at the finest such establishments one is apt to find the most luxurious bedding, maybe a handmade quilt or an antique bed.
translation.sw: Sɛnea ɛte no, wɔ saa mmeae yi mu nea ɛyɛ fɛ paa no, ɛnkyɛ na woanya mpa a wobɛda so a ahotɔ wom, ebia nnaso a wɔde nsa ayɛ anaa tete mpa a ne bo yɛ den.

translation.en: Breakfast may include seasonal delights of the region or the host's speciality dish.
translation.sw: Anɔpa aduane no betumi ayɛ mpɔtam hɔ nnuane a wɔpɛ paa anaasɛ ahɔhogyefo no aduane a ɛda nsow.

translation.en: The setting might be an historic old building with antique furnishings, manicured grounds and a swimming pool.
translation.sw: Ɛhɔ betumi ayɛ tete dan bi a agye din wɔ abakɔsɛm mu a wɔde tete nneɛma a ne bo yɛ den asiesie hɔ, fam a wɔatwa ma ayɛ fɛ ne nsu a ɛtaa hɔ a woguare mu.

translation.en: Getting into your own car and heading off on a long road trip has an intrinsic appeal in its simplicity.
translation.sw: Wobɛtena wo kaa mu na woasim akɔ kwan tenten akwantu yɛ ade a ɛyɛ anika kɛkɛ na ɛnyɛ kyɛnkyerɛkyɛnn biara.

translation.en: Unlike larger vehicles, you are probably already familiar with driving your car and know its limitations.
translation.sw: Wonim w’ankasa kaa a woka no yiye ne nea etumi yɛ ne nea entumi nyɛ, nanso ɛnte saa wɔ kaa akɛse ho.

translation.en: Setting up a tent on private property or in a town of any size can easily attract unwanted attention.
translation.sw: Ntamadan a wobesi wɔ ankorɛankorɛ agyapade so anaasɛ wɔ kurom, ɛmfa ho sɛnea ne kɛse te no betumi atwetwe adwen a ɛmfata aba wo so.

translation.en: In short, using your car is a great way to take a road trip but seldom in itself a way to "camp".
translation.sw: Ne tiatwa mu no, sɛ wode w’ankasa wo kaa no yɛ ɔkwan pa a wobetumi afa so de atu saa kwan yi nanso ɛtɔ mmere bi a eno ara nso yɛ ɔkwan a wɔfa so “soeɛ wɔ abɔnten”.

translation.en: Car camping is possible if you have a large minivan, SUV, Sedan or Station Wagon with seats that lay down.
translation.sw: Sɛ wobɛsoeɛ wɔ wo kaa mu no betumi ayɛ yiye bere a wowɔ bɔɔso ketewa bi, SUV, Sedan anaa station wagon a emu nkonnwa tumi da hɔ.

translation.en: Some hotels have a heritage from the golden age of steam railways and ocean liners; before the Second World War, in the 19th or early 20th centuries.
translation.sw: Ahɔhogyebea binom nyaa wɔn nhyiase fii bere a na wɔde keteke a ɛde ntutu yɛ adwuma ne po so hyɛn akɛse di dwuma no;ansa na Wiase Ko a ɛtɔ so Mmienu reba no, wɔ afeha a ɛtɔ so 19 ne 20 mu no.

translation.en: These hotels were where the rich and the famous of the day would stay, and often had fine dining and nightlife.
translation.sw: Saa ahɔhogyebea yi ne baabi a na asikafo ne wɔn a wɔagye din tena, na mpɛn pii no na wodi nnuane pa na wɔgye wɔn ani anadwo no nso.

translation.en: The old fashioned fittings, the lack of the latest amenities, and a certain graceful agedness are also part of their character.
translation.sw: Tete nneɛma a etwam a wɔde asiesie hɔ, nnɛyi nneɛma ahorow a na enni hɔ saa mmere no ne sɛnea akyɛ nso ɛyɛ fɛ no ka sɛnea na ɛte no ho.

translation.en: While they are usually privately owned, they sometimes accommodate visiting heads of state and other dignitaries.
translation.sw: Bere a na ɛyɛ ankorɛankorɛ de no, na ɛtɔ da a, aman mpaninfo a wɔaba nsrahwɛ ne atitiriw tena hɔ.

translation.en: A traveller with piles of money might consider a round the world flight, broken up with stays in many of these hotels.
translation.sw: Ɔkwantufo a ɔwɔ sika bebree bɛpɛ sɛ ɔfa wimhyɛn a ɛbɛkɔ wiase afanan nyinaa, na egyina mmeae ma wɔtena saa ahɔhogyebea ahorow yi mu.

translation.en: A hospitality exchange network is the organization that connects travelers with locals in the cities they are going to visit.
translation.sw: Ahɔhoyɛ nsesae kuw no yɛ kuw bi a wɔka akwantufo ne kuro a wɔrekɔ hɔ nsrahwɛ no mufo bom.

translation.en: Joining such a network usually just requires filling out an online form; although some networks offer or require additional verification.
translation.sw: Sɛ wobɛdom saa kuw yi a, nea wobɛyɛ ara ne sɛ wobɛhyehyɛ intanɛt so kratawa bi; ɛwom sɛ kuw ahorow bi ma anaa wɔhwehwɛ adanse bi aka ho.

translation.en: A listing of available hosts is then provided either in print and/or online, sometimes with references and reviews by other travelers.
translation.sw: Afei wɔtintim wɔn a wobenya hokwan agye ahɔho wɔ krataa so ne/anaasɛ wɔ intanɛt so, na ɛtɔ da a, wɔde wɔn a wobetumi abisa wɔn ase wɔ wɔn hɔ ka ho ne nea akwantufo afoforo aka afa ho no ka ho.

translation.en: Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004 after computer programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but did not have a place to stay.
translation.sw: Bere tiaa mu asetena hyɛɛ ase wɔ Ɔpɛpɔn 2004 bere a kɔmputa mu nimdefo Casey Fenton nyaa wimhyɛn bi a ne bo yɛ fo kɔɔ Iceland nanso woanya baabi antena no.

translation.en: He emailed students at the local university and received an overwhelming number of offers for free accommodation.
translation.sw: Ɔtoo nkra faa intanɛt so kɔmaa sukuufo a wɔwɔ sukuupɔn a na ɛwɔ hɔ no na onyaa baabi a ɔbɛda a wonye hwee pii a na ɛboro adwen ne ntiase so.

translation.en: Hostels cater primarily to young people – a typical guest is in their twenties – but you can often find older travellers there too.
translation.sw: Asukuufo dabere ahorow no taa hwɛ mmerante ne mmabaawa ̶ wɔn a wɔtaa fa wɔn no wɔ wɔn mfe aduonu mu ̶ nanso wobɛtaa ahu akwantufo a wɔn mfe akɔ anim wɔ hɔ nso.

translation.en: Families with children are a rare sight, but some hostels do allow them in private rooms.
translation.sw: Wontaa nhu mmusua a mmofra ka ho, nanso asukuufo dabere binom ma kwan ma wɔtena ankorɛankorɛ dan mu.

translation.en: The city of Beijing in China will be the host city of the Olympic Winter Games in 2022, which will make it the first city to have hosted both the summer and winter Olympics.
translation.sw: Beijing kuro a ɛwɔ China na Olympic Awɔw bere Agodi a ɛbɛba so wɔ 2022 mu no gyina ne nan so,na wei ɛbɛma abɛyɛ kuro a edi kan a wɔayɛ Olympic no mmienu, ɔhyew ne awɔw mmere mu de no nyinaa.

translation.en: Beijing will host the opening and closing ceremonies and the indoor ice events.
translation.sw: Beijing na dwumadi a wɔde bɛhyɛ ase na wɔde bɛpɔn no si ne nan so na dwumadi a wɔyɛ no nsukyeneso wɔ ɔdan mu no nso ka ho.

translation.en: Other skiing events will be at the Taizicheng ski area in Zhangjiakou, about 220 km (140 miles) from Beijing.
translation.sw: Ski a wɔde hyɛ nan ase sane fa sukyerɛma so dwumadi ahorow no bɛkɔ so wɔ Taizicheng beae a wɔyɛ ski wɔ Zhangjiakou, bɛyɛ 220 km ( akwansini 140) fi Beijing.

translation.en: Most of the temples do have an Annual festival starting from November end to Mid of May, which varies according to each temple's annual calendar.
translation.sw: Asɔredan no mu dodow no ara yɛ afahyɛ afe biara a ɛhyɛ ase Obubuo awiei kosi Kotonimma mfinfini. na nsonsonoe wɔ mu esaine asɔredan biara kalɛnda a odi di dwuma no nti.

translation.en: Most of the temple festivals is celebrated as part of temple's anniversary or presiding deity's birthday or any other major event associated with the temple.
translation.sw: Asɔredan no afahyɛ no mu dodow no ara kɔ so bere a wɔredi asɔredan no afeda anaasɛ onyame a ɔda so no awoda anaa dwumadi titiriw bi a ɛfa asɔredan no ho.

translation.en: Kerala's temple festivals are very interesting to see, with regular procession of decorated elephants, temple orchestra and other festivities.
translation.sw: Kerala asɔredan afahyɛ no yɛ anika paa sɛ worehwɛ a, bere a asono a wɔasiesie wɔn to santen fa kurom, asɔre no adwontofo ne dwumadi ahorow.

translation.en: A World's Fair (commonly called World Exposition, or simply Expo) is large international festival of arts and sciences.
translation.sw: Wiase Aguabɔ (a wɔtaa frɛ no World Exposition, anaa Expo) yɛ afahyɛ kɛse a ɛfa nneɛma a yetumi de yɛn nsa yɛ ne abɔde mu nyansapɛ.

translation.en: Participating countries present artistic and educational displays in national pavilions to showcase world issues or their country's culture and history.
translation.sw: Aman ahorow a wɔde wɔn ahyɛ mu no de nneɛma a yɛde nsa ayɛ ne nea ɛfa adesua ho wɔ national pavilion de da wiase no mu nsɛm ho anaa wɔn man amammerɛ ne history.

translation.en: International Horticultural Expositions are specialised events which showcase floral displays, botanical gardens and anything else to do with plants.
translation.sw: International Horticultural Exposition yɛ dwumadi soronko a wɔde da nhwiren adi, turo ahorow ne biribiara a ɛfa mfifide ho.

translation.en: Although in theory they can take place annually (so long as they are in different countries), in practice they are not.
translation.sw: Sɛ yɛreka a, ebetumi aba so afe biara (nea ehia ara ne sɛ wɔwɔ aman ahorow so), nanso sɛ yɛba ne yɛ mu a, ɛnte saa.

translation.en: These events normally last anywhere between three and six months, and are held on sites no smaller than 50 hectares.
translation.sw: Saa dwumadi ahorow yi di fi abosome mmiɛnsa kosi nsia, na wɔyɛ wɔ mmeae a ne kɛse bɛyɛ sɛ hɛkta 50.

translation.en: There are many different film formats that have been used over the years. Standard 35 mm film (36 by 24 mm negative) is much the commonest.
translation.sw: Yɛwɔ akwan ahorow a wɔde twa mfoni a wɔde adi dwuma mfe bebree ni.Standard 35 mm film (36 by 24 negative) na wɔde di dwuma paa.

translation.en: It can usually be replenished fairly easily if you run out, and gives resolution roughly comparable to a current DSLR.
translation.sw: Wobetumi de foforo ahyɛ mu sɛ ɛsa a, na wode ato senea ɛsɛ sɛ ɛda a wobetumi de atoto nnɛyi DSLR ho.

translation.en: Some medium-format film cameras use a 6 by 6 cm format, more precisely a 56 by 56 mm negative.
translation.sw: Kamɛra no bi de 6 by 6 cm format na edi dwuma, sɛ yɛbɛka no yiye a 56 by 56 mm negative.

translation.en: This gives resolution almost four times that of a 35 mm negative (3136 mm2 versus 864).
translation.sw: Wei ma baabi a ɛda no yɛ papa sen 35 mm negative (3136 mm² versus 864) mmɔho nan.

translation.en: Wildlife is among the most challenging motifs for a photographer, and needs a combination of good luck, patience, experience and good equipment.
translation.sw: Wuram mmoa ne afifide ne adwuma a ɛyɛ den paa ma mfonintwafo, na ohia akraye, ntoboase, suahu ne mfidie a ɛyɛ papa a yɛaka abom.

translation.en: Wildlife photography is often taken for granted, but like photography in general, a picture is worth a thousand words.
translation.sw: Ɛyɛ nea wɔato wuram mmoa ne afifide mfonintwa agyagyamu, nanso sɛnea mfonintwa nyinaa te no, mfoni baako ka nsɛm pii.

translation.en: Wildlife photography often requires a long telephoto lens, though things like a flock of birds or a tiny creature need other lenses.
translation.sw: Wohia kamɛra soronko bi a wɔde twa wuram mmoa ne afifide mfonin, ɛwom sɛ biribi te sɛ nnomaa a ɛretu abom anaa aboa ketewaa bi hia kamɛra foforo de.

translation.en: Many exotic animals are hard to find, and parks sometimes have rules about taking photographs for commercial purposes.
translation.sw: Ɛyɛ den sɛ wobenya mmoa a wofri amanɔne no, na beae ahorow a mmoa no wɔ no, wɔ mmara wɔ mfonin a obi betwa sɛ orekɔtɔn ho.

translation.en: Wild animals might either be shy or aggressive. The environment might be cold, hot, or otherwise hostile.
translation.sw: Wuram mu mmoa betumi afɛre adeɛ anaa w’atow ahyɛ wo so.

translation.en: The world has over 5,000 different languages, including more than twenty with 50 million or more speakers.
translation.sw: Kasa ahorow bɛboro 5000 na ɛwɔ wiase nyinaa, na nnipa bɛyɛ ɔpepem 50 anaa nea ɛboro saa ka emu aduonu.

translation.en: Written words are often easier to understand than spoken words, also. This is especially true of addresses, which are often difficult to pronounce intelligibly.
translation.sw: Ɛnyɛ den nso sɛ wobɛte nsɛm a wɔakyerɛw ase sen nea wɔaka.Wei yɛ nokware bere a worekyerɛ obi w’akyirikwan, a mpɛn pii no ɛyɛ den sɛ wobɛka ma emu ada hɔ.

translation.en: Many entire nations are completely fluent in English, and in even more you can expect a limited knowledge - especially among younger people.
translation.sw: Aman mu bebree ka Borɔfo yiye ankasa; na wɔ bebree mu nso wobetumi ahwɛ kwan sɛ nimdeɛ a wɔwɔ wɔ ho no sua - titiriw no wɔ mmabun no mu.

translation.en: Imagine, if you will, a Mancunian, Bostonian, Jamaican and Sydneysider sitting around a table having dinner at a restaurant in Toronto.
translation.sw: Susuw ho hwɛ, sɛ wobɛyɛ a, Manchesterni, Bostonni,Jamaicani ne Sydneyni te ɔpon ho atwa ahyia redi anwunmmere aduane wɔ adidibea bi wɔ Toronto.

translation.en: They're regaling each other with stories from their hometowns, told in their distinct accents and local argot.
translation.sw: Wɔn mu biara reseresere esaine wɔn kurom nsɛm a wɔreka no nti, na wɔreka no sɛnea wɔka no wɔ kuro kasa mu ne sɛnea wɔbɔ nsɛmfua no.

translation.en: Buying food in supermarkets is usually the cheapest way to get fed. Without cooking opportunities, choices are however limited to ready-made food.
translation.sw: Aduane a wobɛtɔ wɔ supermarket ne ɔkwan a ɛyɛ fo koraa a wobenya biribi adi.Esaine sɛ hokwan pii nni hɔ a wode bɛnoa aduane nti, hokwan a wowɔ ara ne sɛ wobɛtɔ nea wɔanoa dedaw.

translation.en: Increasingly supermarkets are getting a more varied section of ready-made food. Some even provide a microwave oven or other means to heat food.
translation.sw: Supermarket ahorow no anya afa ahorow a aduane a wɔanoa dedaw wɔ hɔ mu nkoanim. Ebinom mpo wɔ afidie a wɔde ka aduane hye anaa ɔkwan foforo a wobetumi afa so aka w’aduane hye.

translation.en: In some countries or types of stores there is at least one on-site restaurant, often a rather informal one with affordable prices.
translation.sw: Wɔ aman bi mu anaa sotɔɔ ahorow mu no, anyɛ yiye koraa no wobenya adidibea wɔ hɔ, mpɛn pii no ɛhɔ nyɛ katee na ne bo nso yɛ.

translation.en: Make and carry copies of your policy and your insurer's contact details with you.
translation.sw: Yɛ wo nsiakyibaa nhyehyɛe no ne wɔn ho nsɛm a ɛbɛma wo nsa aka wɔn no sɛso pii fa hyɛ wo ho.

translation.en: They need to show the insurer's e-mail address and international phone numbers for advice/authorizations and making claims.
translation.sw: Ɛsɛ sɛ wohu wɔn a wɔyɛ nsiakyibaa no intanɛt so ekyirikwan ne wɔn tɛlɛfon nɔma ahorow a wotumi frɛ wɔ baabiara na wɔatumi agye akwankyerɛ/hokwan na wɔatumi nso agye wɔn sika.

translation.en: Have another copy in your luggage and online (e-mail to yourself with attachment, or stored in the "cloud").
translation.sw: Fa krataa no sɛso no bi hyɛ wo nneɛma mu ne intanɛt so (wobetumi de bi ato wo email mu, anaa wobɛkora so wɔ “cloud”).

translation.en: If traveling with a laptop or tablet, store a copy in its memory or disc (accessible without the internet).
translation.sw: Sɛ wode wo laptɔp anaa tablɛt retu kwan no a, wobetumi akora bi wɔ n’adwene no mu anaa nea wɔkyere nsɛm gu so no (wo nsa betumi aka bere a intanɛt nni hɔ no).

translation.en: Also give policy/contact copies to traveling companions and relatives or friends back home willing to help.
translation.sw: Fa wo nsiakyibaa ho nhyehyɛe/wɔn ho nsɛm a ɛbɛma wo nsa aka wɔn no ma nnamfo a wone wɔn retu kwan, abusuafo anaa nnamfo a wɔwɔ fie a wɔbɛpɛ sɛ wɔboa.

translation.en: Moose (also known as elk) aren't inherently aggressive, but will defend themselves if they perceive a threat.
translation.sw: Torɔn (a wɔsan frɛ no elk) nyɛ mmoa a wɔn ani so yɛ hye, nanso wɔbɛbɔ wɔn ho ban bere a wosusuw sɛ esiane bi reba no.

translation.en: When people don't see moose as potentially dangerous, they may approach too closely and put themselves at risk.
translation.sw: Bere a nkurɔfo nhu sɛ Torɔn no ho betumi ayɛ hu no, wɔbɛtwe abɛn wɔn dodow na wɔde wɔn nkwa bɛto asiane mu.

translation.en: Drink alcoholic drinks with moderation. Alcohol affects everyone differently, and knowing your limit is very important.
translation.sw: Nom nsa a ano yɛ den kakraa bi. Ɛsono sɛnea obiara yɛ n’ade bere a woanom nsa no, ɛno nti hu a wobehu nea wobetumi anom no ho hia ankasa.

translation.en: Possible long term health events from excessive drinking can include liver damage and even blindness and death. The potential danger is increased when consuming illegally produced alcohol.
translation.sw: Akwahosan nsɛmsɛm a ebetumi asɔre esaine nsa a wɔnom boro so no bi ne brɛbo a ɛbɛsɛe ne mpo anifurae ne owu. Ɔhaw a yebetumi anya wo mu no yɛ kɛse bere a nsa a wɔyɛ a womfa mmara kwan so no.

translation.en: Illegal spirits can contain various dangerous impurities including methanol, which can cause blindness or death even in small doses.
translation.sw: Nsa a womfa mmara kwan so na wɔyɛ no wɔ nneɛma bi a ɛnyɛ koraa te sɛ methanol, a ebetumi ama obi ani afura anaa woawu nkakrakakra.

translation.en: Eyeglasses can be cheaper in a foreign country, especially in low-income countries where labour costs are lower.
translation.sw: Ahwehwɛniwa bo tumi yɛ fo wɔ ammanɔne aman so, ne titiriw no aman a wɔn sikasɛm ba fam a adwuma ho nsɛm wɔ fam no.

translation.en: Consider getting an eye exam at home, especially if insurance covers it, and bringing the prescription along to be filed elsewhere.
translation.sw: Susuw ho sɛ wobɛyɛ w’ani no mfeefeemu wɔ baabi a wofi, ne titiriw no sɛ nsiakyibaa no betua a, na fa krataa a wɔakyerɛw nnuru no wɔ so no kɔ baabi foforo ma wɔmfa nto hɔ.

translation.en: High-end brand-name frames available in such areas may have two problems; some may be knock-offs, and the real imported ones may be more expensive than at home.
translation.sw: Ade a wɔde ahwehwɛ no hyɛ mu a ɛyɛ papa a agye din wɔ saa mmeae betumi anya ɔhaw mmienu; ebi renyɛ papa, na nea ɛyɛ papa a wɔakra aba no nso bo betumi ayɛ den sen baabi a wofi no.

translation.en: Coffee is one of the world's most traded commodities, and you can probably find many types in your home region.
translation.sw: Kɔfe yɛ nneɛma a wodi ho dwa wɔ wiase paa no mu baako, na wobetumi anya emu ahorow ahorow wɔ mpɔtam a wofi no.

translation.en: Nevertheless, there are many distinctive ways of drinking coffee around the world that are worth experiencing.
translation.sw: Nanso, yɛwɔ akwan ahorow a eda nsow a wɔde nom kɔfe wɔ wiase afanan nyinaa wonnu wo ho sɛ wo sɔ hwɛ a.

translation.en: Canyoning (or: canyoneering) is about going in a bottom of a canyon, which is either dry or full of water.
translation.sw: Canyoning (anaa: canyoneering) ne sɛ wobɛkɔ canyon ase, a ɛhɔ awo anaasɛ nsu ayɛ mu ma no.

translation.en: Canyoning combines elements from swimming, climbing and jumping--but requires relatively little training or physical shape to get started (compared to rock climbing, scuba diving or alpine skiing, for example).
translation.sw: Canyoning ka nsu mu aguare, adeforo ne adehuru mu nneɛma bi bom--nanso ehia ntetee kakraa bi pɛ anaa apɔmuden na woatumi ahyɛase (sɛ yɛde toto abotan a wɔforo,nsu ase a wodware anaa ski a wɔde hyɛ nan ase sane fa sukyerɛma so, sɛ mfatoho no).

translation.en: Hiking is an outdoor activity which consists of walking in natural environments, often on hiking trails.
translation.sw: Hiking yɛ dwumadi a wɔyɛ wɔ abɔnten a wɔnantew fa nwuram, mpɛn pii no wɔ akwan a wɔapaepae ato hɔ sɛ wɔnantew so no.

translation.en: Day hiking involves distances of less than a mile up to longer distances that can be covered in a single day.
translation.sw: Wɔ anɔpa nante mu no wotwa kwan a ennu akwansini baako kosi kwan a emu wa a ebetumi adi da baako.

translation.en: For a day hike along an easy trail little preparations are needed, and any moderately fit person can enjoy them.
translation.sw: Da mu nantew a wɔfa kwan a ɛso nyɛ den no nhia ahosiesie pii, na obi a ɔwɔ ahoɔden kakra biara mpo betumi ayɛ.

translation.en: Families with small children may need more preparations, but a day outdoors is easily possible even with babies and pre-school children.
translation.sw: Mmusua a wɔwɔ mmofra nkumaa behia ahosiesie pii, nanso wobetumi de mmofra ne wɔn a afei na wɔahyɛ sukuu ase no adi da mu no wɔ abɔnten a ɛnyɛ den koraa.

translation.en: Internationally, there are nearly 200 running tour organizations. Most of them operate independently.
translation.sw: Wɔ wiase nyinaa no, wobenya ahyehyɛde a wɔhwɛ ammirika nsrahwɛ ahorow bɛyɛ 200. Wɔn mu dodow no ara yɛ adwuma a wɔnhyɛ abiara ase./wɔn ankasa adwuma.

translation.en: The Global Running Tours successor, Go Running Tours networks dozens of sightrunning providers on four continents.
translation.sw: Wiase nyinaa Ammirikatu Nsrahwɛ nanmusini, Go Running Tours ka wɔn a wɔhwɛ wɔn a wotu mmirika de hwɛ kurom no bebree bom wɔ asasetam anan so.

translation.en: With roots in Barcelona's Running Tours Barcelona and Copenhagen's Running Copenhagen, it was quickly joined by Running Tours Prague based in Prague and others.
translation.sw: Ɛhyɛɛ ase fii Barcelona Ammirikatu Nsrahwɛ a ɛwɔ Barcelona ne Copenhagen Ammirikatu a ɛwɔ Copenhagen, na ankyɛ na Prague Ammirikatu Nsrahwɛ a ɛwɔ Prague ne afoforo bɛdomee.

translation.en: There are many things you have to take into consideration before and when you travel somewhere.
translation.sw: Yɛwɔ nneɛma ahorow a ɛsɛ sɛ wudwen ho ansa na wobetu kwan ne bere a woretu kwan akɔ baabi no.

translation.en: When you travel, expect things not to be like they are "back home". Manners, laws, food, traffic, lodging, standards, language and so on will to some extent differ from where you live.
translation.sw: Sɛ wotu kwan a, nhwɛ kwan sɛ nneɛma bɛyɛ te sɛ “wo kurom” de. Ntetee, mmara, aduane, kaa ahorow, dabere, gyinapɛn ahorow, kasa ne nea ɛkeka ho no bɛyɛ soronko wɔ baabi a wote no.

translation.en: This is something you always need to keep in mind, to avoid disappointment or perhaps even distaste over local ways to do things.
translation.sw: Wei yɛ biribi a ɛsɛ sɛ wode to w’adwen mu, sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ a w’abam remmu anaa sɛnea wɔyɛ wɔn ade no renyɛ wo tan.

translation.en: Travel agencies have been around since the 19th century. A travel agent is usually a good option for a journey which extends beyond a traveller's previous experience of nature, culture, language or low-income countries.
translation.sw: Akwantu asoeɛ awɔ hɔ fi afeha a ɛtɔ so 19 no mu. Obi a ɔhwɛ akwantu so no taa yɛ ɔkwan pa a wobetumi afa so sɛ woretu kwan a ɛsen nea etwaam a wotui wɔ abɔde mu, amammerɛ, kasa anaa aman a wɔn sikasɛm ba fam mu a.

translation.en: Although most agencies are willing to take on most regular bookings, many agents specialise in particular types of travel, budget ranges or destinations.
translation.sw: Ɛmfa ho sɛ asoeɛ ahorow no mu dodow no ara ayɛ krado sɛ wɔbɛgye nea wɔadi kan akora so no, wɔn a wɔhwɛ akwantu so no, wakwadare wɔ akwantu bi te sɛ.

translation.en: It can be better to use an agent who frequently books similar trips to yours.
translation.sw: Ɛbɛyɛ papa sɛ wode obi a ɔhwɛ akwantu so a ɔtaa kora mmeae a ɛte sɛ wode no bedi dwuma.

translation.en: Take a look at what trips the agent is promoting, whether on a website or in a shop window.
translation.sw: Hwɛ akwantu ahorow a nea ɔhwɛ akwantu so no rebɔ ho dawuro,sɛ wobɛhwɛ wɔ wɛbsaet so anaa wɔn sotɔɔ no mpoma no so.

translation.en: If you want to see the world on the cheap, for necessity, lifestyle or challenge, there are some ways to do that.
translation.sw: Sɛ wopɛ sɛ wohu wiase no a wonsɛe sika pii a, sɛ ɛyɛ ahiade, sɛnea wo te anaa nkyia to no, akwan ahorow wɔ hɔ a wobetumi afa ayɛ saa.

translation.en: Basically, they fall into two categories: Either work while you travel or try and limit your expenses. This article is focused on the latter.
translation.sw: Ne tiatwa mu no, ɛwɔ afa mmienu:Sɛ wobɛyɛ adwuma bere a woretu kwan no anaa wobɛbɔ mmɔden ate nea wobɛtɔ so.

translation.en: For those willing to sacrifice comfort, time and predictability to push expenses down close to zero, see minimum budget travel.
translation.sw: Wɔn a wɔpɛ sɛ wɔde wɔn ahotɔ, wɔn bere ne nea ebesi daakye bɔ afɔre sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ a wɔn ka bɛkɔ fam koraa no, hwɛ akwantu a ɛho ka nnɔɔso.

translation.en: The advice assumes that travellers do not steal, trespass, participate in the illegal market, beg, or otherwise exploit other people for their own gain.
translation.sw: Afotu yi fa no sɛ akwantufo nwia ade, nkɔ baabi a ɛnsɛ sɛ wɔkɔ, mfa wɔn ho nhyɛ aguadi a ɛmfa mmara kwan so, nsrɛsrɛ ade, anaa ɔkwan foforo so no nnaadaa afoforo nya wɔn ho.

translation.en: An immigration checkpoint is usually the first stop when disembarking from a plane, a ship, or another vehicle.
translation.sw: Abammɔfo gyinabea ahorow taa yɛ beae a wobedi kan agyina bere a woasi afi wimhyɛn, po so hyɛn, anaa kaa foforo mu no.

translation.en: In some cross-border trains inspections are done on the running train and you should have valid ID with you when boarding one of those trains.
translation.sw: Wɔyɛ keteke a efi ɔman foforo so kɔ ɔman foforo so no mu binom nhwehwɛmu bere a etu nam kwan so no na ɛsɛ sɛ wowɔ ID a edi mu wɔ wo ho bere a worekɔforo saa keteke no mu baako no.

translation.en: On night sleeper trains, passports may be collected by the conductor so that you do not have your sleep interrupted.
translation.sw: Wɔ keteke a wɔda wɔ so no, onii a ɔgyegye sika wɔ so no betumi agye mo paspɔt sɛnea ɛbɛyɛ a ɔnsɛe mo nna no.

translation.en: Registration is an additional requirement for the visa process. In some countries, you must register your presence and address where you are staying with the local authorities.
translation.sw: Din kyerɛw yɛ ahwehwɛde a ɛka ho bere a worekɔyɛ visa no.Wɔ aman ahorow bi so no, ɛsɛ sɛ wokɔ kyerɛw sɛ wowɔ hɔ ne beae a wote wɔ wɔn mpaninfo no hɔ.

translation.en: This might require filling out a form with the local police or a visit to the immigration offices.
translation.sw: Wei bɛhwehwɛ sɛ wobɛhyehyɛ nhoma bi wɔ wɔn polisifo asoeɛ anaa wokɔsra atubrafo ɔfese ahorow.

translation.en: In many countries with such a law, local hotels will handle the registration (make sure to ask).
translation.sw: Wɔ aman bebree a wɔwɔ saa mmara yi no, ahɔhogyebea ahorow a ɛwɔ hɔ no hwɛ din kyerɛw no so (bɔ mmɔden bisa).

translation.en: In other cases, only those staying outside of tourist accommodations need to register.  However, this makes the law much more obscure, so find out beforehand.
translation.sw: Wɔ tebea foforo mu no, wɔn a wɔte baabi a ɛnyɛ nsrahwɛ dabere no hia sɛ wɔkyerɛw wɔn din.Nanso wei ma wonhu mmara no ani so yiye, enti di kan hwehwɛmu ansa.

translation.en: Architecture is concerned with the design and construction of buildings. The architecture of a place is often a tourist attraction in its own right.
translation.sw: Adanwinni no yɛ sɛnea wɔnwinni dan na wosi no no. Sɛnea wosi fa nwinni dan na wosi no no mpo yɛ nea ɛtwe nkurɔfo ma wɔbɛhwɛ hɔ.

translation.en: Many buildings are quite beautiful to look at and the view from a tall building or from a cleverly-positioned window can be a beauty to behold.
translation.sw: Adan ahorow pii yɛ fɛ sɛ worehwɛ a , na sɛ wogyina ɛdan tenten so anaa mpoma bi a ɛda yiye a, sɛnea wohu no no yɛ fɛ kɛkɛ.

translation.en: Architecture overlaps considerably with other fields including urban planning, civil engineering, decorative arts, interior design and landscape design.
translation.sw: Adanwinni ne nwuma ahorow binom te sɛ wɔn a wɔhyehyɛ nkuraa, mfididwumayɛfo, wɔn a wɔdrɔm nneɛma, wɔn a wosiesie dan mu ne wɔn a wosiesie afifide ma no yɛ fɛ no bom yɛ adwuma.

translation.en: Given how remote many of the pueblos are, you won't be able to find a significant amount of nightlife without traveling to Albuquerque or Santa Fe.
translation.sw: Esaine sɛnea nkuro no wowɔ akyi nti, gye sɛ wo tu kwan kɔ Albuquerque anaa Santa Fe sɛ wopɛ sɛ wonya anigyede a etumi tua mu kosi anɔpa bi a.

translation.en: However, nearly all of the casinos listed above serve drinks, and several of them bring in name-brand entertainment (primarily the large ones immediately surrounding Albuquerque and Santa Fe).
translation.sw: Nanso, casino a wɔabobɔ din wɔ soro hɔ no mu dodow no ara ma nsa, na wɔn mu binom de anigyede a wɔn a wɔagye din ayɛ ( akɛse a na ɛwom a na etwa Albuquerque ne Santa Fe ho).

translation.en: Beware: small-town bars here are not always good places for the out-of-state visitor to hang out.
translation.sw: Hyɛ no nsow sɛ, beae a wɔtɔn nsa wɔ nkuro nketewa mu no ntaa nyɛ baabi papa ma wɔn a wofi baabi foforo na aba hɔ no sɛ wɔbɛtenatena.

translation.en: For one thing, northern New Mexico has significant problems with drunk driving, and the concentration of intoxicated drivers is high close to small-town bars.
translation.sw: Wɔ ɔkwan baako so no, New Mexico atifi fam hɔ wɔ wɔn a wɔnom nsa ka kaa ho nsɛmsɛm pii na ahyɛnkafo a wɔbo de ka kaa no dɔɔso wɔ mmeae a wɔtɔn nsa wɔ nkuro nketewa mu.

translation.en: Unwanted murals or scribble is known as graffiti.
translation.sw: Wɔfrɛ nneɛma a w’adrɔm anaa w’akyerɛwkyerɛw wɔ afasu ho no sɛ graffiti.

translation.en: While it's far from a modern phenomenon, most people probably associate it with youth vandalizing public and private property using spray paint.
translation.sw: Bere a ɛnyɛ nnɛyi adeyɛ no, nnipa pii de kyerɛ sɛ ɛyɛ mmabun a wɔde aduro a wɔde ka dan ho sɛe ɔman ne ankorɛankorɛ agyapade no na wɔyɛ saa.

translation.en: However, nowadays there are established graffiti artists, graffiti events and "legal" walls. Graffiti paintings in this context often resemble artworks rather than illegible tags.
translation.sw: Nanso, nnansa yi mu no yɛwɔ wɔn a wɔdrɔm nneɛma wɔ afasu ho a wɔagye wɔn atom, graffiti dwumadi ahorow ne “mmara kwan so” afasu.Nneɛma a wɔka ho wɔ saa dwumadi yi mu sɛ ade a wɔahyɛda adrɔm no yiye sen biribi a wɔayɛ a wonhu so.

translation.en: Boomerang throwing is a popular skill that many tourists want to acquire.
translation.sw: Dua a akoa a wɔtow no yɛ nsa ano dwuma a agye din a nsrahwɛfo pii pɛ sɛ wonya.

translation.en: If you want to learn throwing a boomerang that comes back to your hand, make sure you have a suitable boomerang for returning.
translation.sw: Sɛ wobɛpɛ sɛ wosua sɛnea wɔtow dua no ma ɛsan ba wo nsam a, hwɛ hu sɛ wowɔ dua a woayɛ no yiye a ebetumi asan n’akyi.

translation.en: Most boomerangs available in Australia are in fact non-returning. It is best for beginners to not try throwing in windy
translation.sw: Dua a akoa a wɔtow no mu dodow a ɛwɔ Australia yɛ nea ɛnsan mma n’akyi.

translation.en: A Hangi Meal is cooked in a hot pit in the ground.
translation.sw: Wɔnoa aduane a wɔfrɛ no Hangi wɔ tokuro a emu yɛ hye a wɔatu wɔ fam mu.

translation.en: The pit is either heated with hot stones from a fire, or in some places geothermal heat makes areas of ground naturally hot.
translation.sw: Wɔde aboɔ a wɔde agu gya mu ma ayɛ hye na wɔde gu tokuro no mu, anaa wɔ mmeae bi no wɔde ɔhyew a efi asase no mu a ɛma fam yɛ hye no na ɛyɛ.

translation.en: The hangi is often used to cook a traditional roast style dinner.
translation.sw: Wɔde Hangi no noa anwummere aduane a wɔde tete kwan so toto no.
